title: How do I setup threshold on sp_monitorconfig metadata in ASE 16.x?
text: Greetings, How do I setup threshold on sp_monitorconfig metadata in ASE 16.x? So I have alerts on the event.Thanks,Sid.
author: Siddhartha Sarkar
Bret Halford
text: I don't think there is any way you can set a direct threshold.You could use a cron job / Job Scheduler task to check the values on a regular basis.Some of the values do put warning messages in the errorlog when scavenging starts to happen and these can be picked up by an errorlog monitor.
title: Re:How do I setup threshold on sp_monitorconfig metadata in ASE 16.x?

author: Siddhartha Sarkar
text: Thanks Bret.Thinking that ASE has worked on such feature already I Was trying to replace our existing cron job with similar logic you suggested.Thank You,Sid.
title: Re:How do I setup threshold on sp_monitorconfig metadata in ASE 16.x?

author: Avinash Kothare
text: SidFor storage space management SAP/Sybase has provided sp_thresholdaction mechanism.This allows you to customize space usage/free thresholds and corresponding action as your site may need.Unfortunately for metadata usage / over-usage there is no such mechanism for you to customize. So you can pretty much write your own script(s) for the logic and schedule your job(s) accordingly.Unlike space issue, metadata over usage in most cases is NOT a show stopper. Server will survive with some messages in ASE error log. HTHAvinash
title: Re:How do I setup threshold on sp_monitorconfig metadata in ASE 16.x?

How to find list pf stored procedures being executed in past hour?
text: Hello, How do I find out from MDA tables the average execution time, max execution time, io etc. statistics and list of stored procedures that have been executed past one hour or past 5 munutes? We are using "Adaptive Server Enterprise/16.0 SP01 PL01/EBF 24358"Thank You,Sid.

title: Re:Looking For ODBC Driver

author: Avinash Kothare
text: SidNote : MDA tables depend on sampling. So any procedures that execute in less than the sample interval are likely to slip through and will not figure on the radar.At our site we sample the process related MDA tables every minute. So procedures that execute in a minute are likely to go unnoticed.ASE 15.5I use monProcessStatement  MDA table for getting statistics on stored procedure executions.This has ProcedureID column. Along with DBID column this can get you the procedure name.Note that this MDA table gives you figures for each statement execution within the procedure.So for a given SPID + KPID + DBID + ProcedureID + StartTime I take the first/earliest entry and the last/latest entry to get progress and statistics of the procedure execution of a statementFor a given SPID + KPID + DBID + ProcedureID earliest start time and latest time stamp can give you approximate execution window. And we have sum up the from the figures for statement as above.If you can have one perpetual connection to collect MDA historical table then you can find similar data from monSysStatement. It has execution end time for a statement.ASE 16.xThe version does have a MDA table called monProcessProceduresThis table has columns related to execution statistics (e.g. ExecutionCount, ExecutionTime, CPUTime) And these are also by captured by statement just like the xxxStatement tables.I have NOT experimented with this one yet.HTH Avinash
title: Re:How to find list pf stored procedures being executed in past hour?

author: Siddhartha Sarkar
text: Thanks for your response Avinash. This is really helpful.What I understand monProcessProcedures has the list of processes that are still active and execution of the underline stored procedure or SQL statement may not have been completed yet. Except for few Spring Batch jobs we are executing only SP for most of our applications. Looks like master..monSysStatement table is a good candidate for us.I assume sum by SPID, KPID, DBID, ProcedureID where object_name(ProcedureID, DBID) is not nullAnd then avg by DBID, ProcedureID would do what we are looking for.Sid.
title: Re:How to find list pf stored procedures being executed in past hour?

replication definition
text: Hi,Is there any way to check if Replication server is using Replication definitions to apply changes on standby?Regards,Marc
author: Marc Daccache
Mark A Parsons
text: Running 'rs_helprep' in the RSSD will spit out a list of all repdefs. You could then scan this list for any repdefs associated with the WS connection.To get just a list of repdefs associated with a specific WS connection ... off the top of my head ...========================select o.objtype, -- 'R' for table repdef, 'F' for proc/function repdef o.objname -- name of repdeffrom rs_databases d, rs_objects o, rs_sites swhere s.name = '<repserver_name>'and d.dsname = '<logical_dataserver>' -- WS logical connectionand d.dbname = '<logical_database>' -- WS logical connectionand o.prsid = s.idand o.dbid = d.dbid========================
title: Re:replication definition

author: Marc Daccache
text: Hi Mark,Thanks for the info, but let me explain what I really need to know.Suppose that I have already created repdefs and I just need to double check if these repdefs will be used by RS.I can think about some traces in RS (i.e. trace "on",dsi,dsi_buf_dump)...Does it help, or is there any other way to check?Regards,Marc
title: Re:replication definition

author: Mark A Parsons
text: There's no easy way to tell if a repdef *will* be used by RS.A mismatch in the owner flag (eg, PDB table marked with owner on; repdef created without an owner) will keep a repdef from being used; obviously a typo in a name (ds, db, object, owner) will cause a repdef to be ignored; etc).--------As for how to tell if a repdef is *being* used by RS ... I'm not aware of any (monitor) counters that keep track of how often specific repdefs are utilized, nor am I aware of any traces that explicitly list which repdef(s) are applied to a transaction.NOTE: Keep in mind that the documentation on monitor counters and traces is somewhat limited so *maybe* there's something out there ... *shrug*--------The way I typically tell if a repdef is being used is to run a test transaction in the PDB and see what the DSI spits out.My preference is to watch the (ASE) RDS's monSysSQLText table, but a dsi buf dump would also work (especially for non-ASE targets).Obviously you'll need to have an idea of what you think the DSI should be submitting in order to tell if the repdef is being used (eg, you expect to see 2 columns used in the 'where' clause of a DELETE or UPDATE statement; DSI is issuing a 'set identity_insert on/off' wrapper for a column defined (in the repdef) as 'identity'; etc).Assuming this is a generic WS setup where the PDB and RDB contents should be 100% identical then you could run some sort of data comparison (eg, rs_subcmp, Data Assurance) to verify the contents of a pair of pdb/rdb tables (eg, to make sure the correct PK column set has been defined).--------For future reference re: Sybase Replication Server (SRS) questions, you may want to post in the Sybase Replication Server forum; you'll likely get the attention of a few more SRS knowledgeable folks.
title: Re:replication definition

author: Avinash Kothare
text: MarcHow about rs_helprepversion <repdefname / repdefversionid>It should show you if repdef is actively used !HTHAvinash
title: Re:replication definition

text: Hi Ram,I remember there being some issues with parameters and ado.net. The first thing I suggest is upgrading to the current version of the ado.net driver 15.7.0.1300 from SDK for SAP ASE 15.7 SP130 or SDK for SAP ASE 16.0 SP00 PL04.The bugs dealt specifically with these issues passing nulls for specific datatypes and/or if the datatype on the ASE is a user identified type.Another thing to look at is if you have NamedParameters in the connection string? author: Paul Vero
text: Hi Ram,Please post the code portion and include connection string. You are going from very old Provider to a very current one and possibly running into some issues with either parsing in the Provider or maybe something changed in how we should process this command.Anyway, let's see what the code looks like. Dawn mentioned the "Trial edition" - this isn't trial - this is free SDK.Go to the link https://store.sap.com/sap/cpa/ui/resources/store/html/StoreFront.htmlOn bottom - Database and TechnologyIn search field enter "SAP SDK for Adaptive Server Enterprise"The top two offerings are 15.7 SP127 and 15.7 SP130 (sorry they aren't labeled nicely).Select SP130. Click Free Trial button (this label is a misnomer - this isn't a trial - it is the actual software) Fill in the form and then email will be sent with link to the actual download page - select windows 64 bit platform.I need to see your code before I tell you what you might be able to do in order for it to work. The implication here is you're going to bind a parameter to the command. Typically with stored procedures in ADO.NET we see a lot more of the folks setting command type to stored procedure and then binding the parameters by name one after the other.In your case looks like newer provider is sending the command literally (ADO.NET doesn't do prepared statements like ODBC Driver can). Maybe with code some changes can be made to get it to work. Or if parsing issue, maybe newer Provider resolves.

Sap ASE 16
text: can I use statement INSERT INTO tablename default values at the time of creating trigger in sap Ase 16.0, I got the error like Incorrect syntax near the keyword 'default'., same trigger statement is successfully executed in SQL server 2012.
author: rahul srivastava
Bret Halford
text: Please post a simple example of the actual syntax that is failing. In general, you can use INSERT statements in triggers.-bret
title: Re:Sap ASE 16

author: Kevin Sherlock
text: That is not legal syntax in SAP ASE. SQL Server 2012 and SAP ASE use a slightly different dialect of SQL. They are two different products. My best advice would be to bookmark the ASE documentation for statement syntax.http://infocenter.sybase.com/help/topic/com.sybase.infocenter.dc36272.1600/doc/html/title.html
title: Re:Sap ASE 16

author: rahul srivastava
text: Thanks to both of you , below are the create trigger statmentCREATE TRIGGER test on temp-- Here's the operation typeFOR UPDATEAS--local variablesdeclare @countofrows intdeclare @seqId numeric(18)declare @sourceId numeric(18)declare @transSyncIdCode varchar(40)declare @transSyncSeqNum numeric(18)-- save off the row countselect @countofrows = @@rowcountif not update(transStatusTypeId) returnif not update(updateId) begin if @countofrows = 0 return -- get values out of inserted select @transSyncIdCode = transSyncIdCode from inserted select @sourceId = sourceId from inserted select @transSyncSeqNum = transSyncSeqNum from inserted -- nust generate a new sequence value INSERT INTO temp2 default values(Error throws ) If @@error <> 0 begin --return raiserror('test trigger failed Next Sequence insert failed for temp2 table with errorcode=%d',16,1,@@error) end -- get next sequence value select @seqId = @@Identity --Sets UpdateId to previously generated identity make sure the where clause is indexed update temp set updateId = @seqId where temp.transSyncIdCode = @transSyncIdCode and temp.sourceId = @sourceId and temp.transSyncSeqNum = @transSyncSeqNum If @@error <> 0 begin raiserror('tr_Updatetemp trigger failed update failed for temp table where TransSyncIdCode=%d and sourceId=%d with error code=%d',16,1,@transSyncIdCode,@sourceId,@@error) end -- delete the sequence make sure that the seqId is indexed delete from temp2 where seqId=@seqIdend;
title: Re:Sap ASE 16

author: Bret Halford
text: OK. The literal string "default values" is indeed not valid syntax for ASE.You can have an insert that provides hardcoded literals as default values:INSERT INTO temp2 values (1,2,3)It sounds like temp2 might simply exist to generate identity values. If temp2 contains only an identity column [ example: create table temp2 (id int identity) ], you can useINSERT INTO temp2 values ()

author: Vladimir Skaletsky
Dawn Kim
text: Hi Vladimir,I think you need to update your MDA odbc scripts. Try this first and update me with the results.* Updating the metadata stored procedures required by ODBC, OLE DB and  jConnect Drivers on Adaptive Server Enterprise Certain new features and bug fixes in ODBC, OLE DB and jConnect drivers  require you to modify the metadata stored procedures in Adaptive Server.  These stored procedures may not be up-to-date on your host ASE server due  to various reasons. If the metadata stored procedures are outdated, you may not be able to use  some of the fixes that are implemented in this SP/ESD, so you will need to  manually install the updated metadata stored procedures. To update the metadata stored procedures in Adaptive Server, first determine  the version of the meta-data scripts installed on the ASE. To do so, execute  the following command: sp_version go The version number of the ODBC, OLE DB and jConnect meta-data scripts will  be displayed. Review the version number column and compare it against the version of the  driver being used.  If the metadata scripts are outdated, the version installed will be older  than the driver build number or you will encounter one of the following: - stored procedure sp_version is not found - the stored procedure output does not print a row for the driver The updated scripts are included with the drivers and can be installed as  follows: For ODBC & OLE DB: - Go the "sp" directory under the ODBC/OLE DB installation directory - Execute the install_odbc_sprocs script for the ODBC Driver and  install_oledb_sprocs script for OLE DB Provider. Syntax for using the script is: install_[odbc/olebd]_sprocs <ServerName> <username> [<password>] where <ServerName> is the name of the Adaptive Server <username> is the username to connect to the server [<password>] is the password the username (dont supply this for null password) For jConnect: - Go to the "sp" directory under the jConnect installation directory. Based  on your host ASE server version, choose the appropriate SQL script.  - Use isql or another tool of your choice to execute the selected script.  This will install the current meta-data stored procedures.Thanks,Dawn Kim

author: Chris Baker
text: As IQ stores data column-wise and compressed, there is no such thing as table fragmentation.The nBitFP indexes however may roll over to flatFP as the cardinality increases. When data is subsequently deleted in a column, you can rebuild the indexes to their tokenized form using sp_iqrebuildindexYou can check index statistics in IQ using the following procedures:sp_iqindexmetadatasp_iqindexinfosp_iqindexsizesp_iqrowdensityChris
title: Re:what is table/index fragmentation ? how to check table is fragmented or not in SYBASE ASE

author: Mark Kusma
text: You will need to contact your Sales Rep to request a trial license that allows more than 1 engine. It would be time-based to allow x number of days. Once you have the license, you would place the license file in $SYBASE/SYSAM-2_0/licenses/ directory and use the following commands from isql:sp_lmconfig 'edition','EE'gosp_lmconfigu 'license type',<type>gowhere <type> is the value found after LT=xx in the license file. The xx will likely be "CP", in which case the command is:sp_lmconfig 'license type','CP'goIf you run into problems once you have the license, feel free to reply here or start a new thread.Mark
title: Re:How to get trial license to convert from developer edition

author: Mark A Parsons
text: While it's possible to install different versions of ASE on the same Windows platform, doing so requires the operator to manually update the user and system variables accordingly (eg, remove all ASE related variables from the system variables list), and likely requiring instances of the different ASE software to run under different user ids (ie, to allow running under different sets of user variabvles).Net result is that installing/running different ASE versions on the same Windows platform is not really supported 'out of the box' and thus requires a good bit of end user tweaking. 'out of the box' you'll likely find yourself with an unwanted mixing of libraries due to the mish-mash of incompatible user and system variable settings.Similar issues can arise if you try to install different Sybase products on Windows where said Sybase products are based on different releases of the SDK (eg, running ASE 15.1 and Repserver 15.7.1 would likely see major runtime issues). Again, the problems come down to an unwanted mixing of libraries due to the mish-mash of user and system variables.NOTE: You may have better luck installing different ASE versions on a Windows *server* where each ASE version is installed under a different user/login.Personally, I would never try installing different ASE versions on the same Windows (non-server platform) machine other than as a step to upgrade the older ASE version with the newer ASE version.----------------As for the need to unzip the files on linux ... that doesn't sound right. I'm guessing either the zip file is corrupt or the file is misnamed (eg, was originally a linux/unix *.tgz file but someone changed extension to *.zip).

text: Sybase and now SAP don't keep archived versions of their software. You might find such a patch via nefarious ways though. The legality of obtaining such a patch will vary from country to country but generally, it is a bad idea to do so. Upgrade if you can or migrate it to another dbms (your application may work with another dbms - check with your vendor).

author: Paul Vero
text: Hi Mark,I believe this is a new cr I just logged for the drivers (ODBC and ADO.NET). CR is 776257. On Windows 2012 and 8, the Open fails when connecting to certain ASEs with default charsets like cp850, cp437. We don't know why this happens but I escalated the CR.What I found might workCharset=ClientDefaultCodePageType=otherClientCharset=iso_1 (or what you would like ASE to convert)What is your default charset on ASE?At this time since I just logged the CR I don't know the ETA. Our next big SDK 15.7 release is SP133 due sometime in Q1. However, I don't think this CR will make the cut. At this time, let me know your ASE default charset and we can go from there.An example is if ASE is cp850 and you set to iso_1, the driver will ask ASE to use iso_1 so it will convert cp850 chars to iso_1. The caveat here is some graphic chars in cp850 aren't mapped in iso_1 so there would be some issue there if that is the case.Cheers,-PaulASE Connectivity NEXUS, Support ArchitectUS AD&T Product Support ADO.NET,ODBC, OLEDB, JDBC, ECDA, DC/MVS and moreASE survey: https://www.sapsurvey.com/cgi-bin/qwebcorporate.dll?idx=WUUNJW

author: Paul Vero
text: Hi Mark,I tested this out again and found on my Windows 8 system I was testing that the SYBASE environment was messed up. I had installed some product that set SYBASE variable but this product had no Connectivity - no interfaces file (sql.ini) and no charsets resource.One of the reasons to get this error is if you deploy the Provider to the system without installing the SDK, the lack of charsets folder under the SYBASE root directory can cause this error to happen - so say for example ASE is cp850. The Windows client is normally cp1252. By default Provider connects to ASE to use cp850 as code page (charset) and without the resource in charsets for mappings, due to how the Provider handles conversions internally (it is natively Unicode internally) it's possible with the charsets resource the error occurs.Now I know Windows 8 is different than Windows 2012. But there shouldn't be significant changes in how to handle charsets unless, as stated, SYBASE\charsets is missing. I have requested to integrate charsets into the DLL but this isn't looking to be happening. However, one thing to try, if this description is the case is to create a SYBASE directory on the machine in question, copy charsets to it, set a SYBASE variable to the SYBASE directory created, then test Provider under this environment with default properties to see if this works.At the least it would be an interim resolution. If I find these types of issues keep happening I'll crank up the noise on the feature logged. There is also possibility to provide some connection option to locate this charset resource on machine provided it is copied to the machine. I don't have details yet on this until we complete implementation later this year.Cheers,-Paul
title: Re:Connecting to ASE 15.7 from Windows Server 2012

Migrate system tables from ASE 15.0.3 AIX to Linux X86-64.
text: Folks,Could someone please let me know the list of system tables from master database I need to bcp out from AIX and bcp into Linux for ASE cross platform migration from 15.0.x to 15.7. Here is the list I have. syslogins, sysusers (may be for rep-server), sysloginroles, sysservers, syssrvroles(may be).As I do not have my Linux box yet I cannot really test it.Will there be any compatibility issue with syslogins beside few additional columns? Will users be able to login with there password? Hoping the encryption in syslogins password remains same.Thanks,Sid.
author: Siddhartha Sarkar
Mark A Parsons
text: Which tables to copy over is going to depend on *what* you wish to copy over, eg:- there are quite a few items in sysattributes that you may (not) want to copy vs re-apply the DDL (eg, cache bindings, tempdb bindings, etc)- do you have any aliases => sysalternates- do you have any custom messages => sysusermessages- do you have any custom roles in use in the master database => sysrolesYou might want to take a look at the ASE 15.7 Utility Guide, Chapter: Migrating Data Using sybmigrate. While you could try using sybmigrate to copy over your server-level details, I'd suggest you take a look at the sections on what sybmigrate does and does not do, if simply to give you a checklist of all the various components you may want to think about migrating to the new server.------------------One area where you may have problems is with the passwords stored in syslogins.Prior to ASE 15.0.2 the password was encrypted based on the hardware/endian structure.With ASE 15.0.2+ the password encryption is performed using a hardware independent library. Net result is that with ASE 15.0.2+ you can copy passwords between endian architectures without problems.I'm guessing you could have problems copying ASE 15.0/AIX (big endian) passwords to ASE 15.7/linux (little endian), though there's one way to know for sure ... When in doubt, try it out.
title: Re:Migrate system tables from ASE 15.0.3 AIX to Linux X86-64.

Migrating from 15.0.3 64-bits to 15.7 64-bits
text: We are upgrading our systems from Sybase 15.0.3 64.bits to 15.7 64-bits (Adaptive Server Enterprise/15.7/EBF 21984 SMP SP110 /P/RS6000/AIX 6.1/ase157sp11x/3546/64-bit/FBO.) We are having trouble making 2 of 65 batch jobs work. We use ctlib (Sybase CTISQL Utility/15.7/P-EBF20092 ESD #4/DRV.15.7.0.4/RS6000/AIX 6.1/BUILD1570-015/OPT/Thu) We have assumed that 15.7 is upward compatible and have not changed our applications other than recompiling and linking with new libraries. The error we are experiencing is that we somehow seem to loose our cursor. There are no errors reported in the database logs and hence we assume that we receive an error from ctlib. The error is happening often but we have also been able to run the two jobs without errors. The jobs are retrieving and updating data in two databases on the same database server.We have looked for solved errors and bug id 735036 seem to be somewhat similar but it says that this has been corrected in SP100 (we are running SP 110).The structure of the code is like this:Select rows from a table (in db1) with cursorWhile still rows to be treated Fetch a row and get the data (10 rows fetched from the cursor at a time) Start transaction do some more selects and updates (in db2) based on the information from the fetched row end transaction delete the row (in db1)end whileThe second time the fetch tries to read from the cursor, it has been closed.Just to see what happened we replaced the DELETE with an UPDATEIt still failed using the UPDATE command but had fetched quite a few more rows than the DELETE command allowed us to do. (Using UPDATE it failed after 197 rows rather than 10).This is the select statement setting up the cursor that fails:SELECT TST_F4..TRANS_LINJE.TRANS_ID,TST_F4..TRANS_LINJE.TRANS_LINJE_NR,TST_F4..TRANS_LINJE.TRANS_STATUS,TST_F4..TRANS_LINJE.DATA_LINJE,TST_F4..TRANS_LINJE.LOCK_FLAG FROM TST_F4..TRANS_LINJE,TST_F4..TRANS T_O1 WHERE ((TST_F4..TRANS_LINJE.TRANS_STATUS=?)) AND ((T_O1.HOVED_AKT=? AND T_O1.TRANS_TYPE=? AND T_O1.TRANS_STATUS=? AND TST_F4..TRANS_LINJE.TRANS_ID=T_O1.TRANS_ID)) ORDER BY TST_F4..TRANS_LINJE.TRANS_ID,TST_F4..TRANS_LINJE.TRANS_LINJE_NRSelect with CURSORAnyone else experiencing similar problems?
author: Hanne Berg Larsen
Bret Halford
text: How is the cursor declared? Is it "for update"? Sensitive or sermi-sensitive?
title: Re:Migrating from 15.0.3 64-bits to 15.7 64-bits

author: Mette Wam
text: The code that is running has "survived" several upgrades and has not been changed for years. The paramaeters sensitive / semi-sensitive are new in 15.7? We have assumed that the code will be upward compatible.This is from the tracefile:ct_cmd_alloc--cmdptr:203cddccContext: 0 Connection: 201b2598 Command: 0ct_dynamic--type:717 id:s11 idelen:-9 buf:SELECT TST_F4..TRANS_LINJE.TRANS_ID,TST_F4..TRANS_LINJE.TRANS_LINJE_NR,TST_F4..TRANS_LINJE.TRANS_STATUS,TST_F4..TRANS_LINJE.DATA_LINJE,TST_F4..TRANS_LINJE.LOCK_FLAG FROM TST_F4..TRANS_LINJE,TST_F4..TRANS T_O1 WHERE ((TST_F4..TRANS_LINJE.TRANS_STATUS=?)) AND ((T_O1.HOVED_AKT=? AND T_O1.TRANS_TYPE=? AND T_O1.TRANS_STATUS=? AND TST_F4..TRANS_LINJE.TRANS_ID=T_O1.TRANS_ID)) ORDER BY TST_F4..TRANS_LINJE.TRANS_ID,TST_F4..TRANS_LINJE.TRANS_LINJE_NR buflen:-9Context: 0 Connection: 0 Command: 203d3478ct_send--Context: 0 Connection: 0 Command: 203d3478And this is the debug information when it fails:ct_cmd_dropContext: 0 Connection: 0 Command: 20407868CT_DBG_ERROR: All handles passed into function are NULL(CS_FAIL) file ctcursor.c, line 1103
title: Re:Migrating from 15.0.3 64-bits to 15.7 64-bits

author: Mark A Parsons
text: Cursor sensitivity has been around since early ASE 15.x (not sure if it was ASE 15.0, or 15.0.x).Without more details about *HOW* the cursors are defined I'm going to assume:- UPDATE/DELETE statements do not include the clause 'where current of <cursor_name>'- cursor is not defined as 'read only'- cursor is instantiated as semisensitive (this is the default setting if no sensitivity clause provided in the 'declare cursor' command)- while the cursor is open, any changes to the underlying data causes the cursor result set to change, which in turn can cause cursor to abort/break if it tries to fetch a row that has now changed/moved within the result setIf the above describes your situation then I'd recommend making the following changes to your cursor declaration statement:- define as insensitive (declare <cursor_name> insensitive cursor for ...); this causes the cursor to populate a worktable with the cursor's SELECT statement results; the cursor then fetches from the worktable thus insuring that changes to the underlying table(s) does not affect the cursor's result set- define with 'for read only'NOTE: These are T-SQL (ie, server-side) recommendations; if you're using client-side cursors you'll need to figure out how to make similar changes on the client-side (eg, see client-side coding reference manuals, wait for a client-side knowledgeable person to respond in this thread)-----------------And yes, I've seen similar behavior before ...- ASE 15.5- client application was written in microfocus cobol and was submitting T-SQL command strings to the dataserver- a developer setup a new cursor-based process to update/delete rows and was seeing sporadic issues with his cursor ... crashing, aborting, some rows not getting updated/deleted as expected, etc- issue was tracked back to the same issues I outlined in my assumptions (above) ... semi-sensitive cursor going walkabout when the underlying data changed midstream- issue was fixed by adding the 'insensitive' and 'for read only' clauses to the cursor declaration
title: Re:Migrating from 15.0.3 64-bits to 15.7 64-bits

author: Mette Wam
text: We have no concluded that the ct_cursor statement is not upward compatible from Version 15.0.3 to Version 15.7. We are trying to set parameter CS_NOSCROLL_INSENSITIVE but has run into another problem. SAP/Sybase has now reproduced the case on Sybase 15.7 on AIX 7.1 where CT-lib "An illegal value of 4096 given for parameter option"
title: Re:Migrating from 15.0.3 64-bits to 15.7 64-bits
Text Data Corruption Post Sybase Upgrade to 15.5 from 12.5.4
text: Our Environment is Linuc 5.4 . Sybase 15.5@@version ==> Adaptive Server Enterprise/15.5/EBF 19399 SMP ESD#5/P/x86_64/Enterprise Linux/asear155/2568/64-bit/FBO/Fri Dec 9 02:45:22 2011 Our "default character set id" is set to 1.We noticed post our upgrade to sybas 15.5 from sybase 12.5.4 our text data columns specifically the ones which had ascii codes > 127 have got corrupted.Example :- MSWord quote "" now is stored as  ascii value 226 ....and this is true for all the ascii values > 126. and if update the text data , it gives us even more garabe. Also we are noticing if we try to insert new data into our text columns , which ascii > 127 , it also gets coruppted.Question :- 1. How to restore our courrpted data back to what it was in the db prior 15.5 2. going forward how do we store data with special characters ascii > 127 into our database.
author: vishal chadha
Bret Halford
text: How did you do the upgrade? (Entire server in-place, dump and load database, sybmigrate, or ddl + bcp?)It sounds like the character set configuration has been changed without converting the data.From your example, the closing quote mark (SINGLE HIGH-REVERSED-9 QUOTATION MARK ) which in utf8 is 0xe2809b is being displayed as if it were an "a" with circumflex, which in iso-1 is 0xe2, the first byte of the utf8 value.Are you sure the default character set on 12.5.x was iso1 (1) rather than utf8 (190, I think)?The default character set for ASE on Linux is utf8, so it is a bit unusual for it to be iso1.Do you have dumps of the 12.5.x database before it was upgraded?
title: Re:Text Data Corruption Post Sybase Upgrade to 15.5 from 12.5.4

author: vishal chadha
text: Bret>>>How did you do the upgrade? (Entire server in-place, dump and load database, sybmigrate, or ddl + bcp?)Upgrade was entire server in place upgrade.>>> Are you sure the default character set on 12.5.x was iso1 (1) rather than utf8 (190, I think)?For some reason all of our sybase servers in the firm are on ISO1 character set. and our 12.5.4 was also on IS01 character set.>>>Do you have dumps of the 12.5.x database before it was upgraded?Our DBA's are trying to restore our 12.5.4 backup to a new db server.
title: Re:Text Data Corruption Post Sybase Upgrade to 15.5 from 12.5.4

author: vishal chadha
text: Found the Issue Finally:- Nothing to do with the Upgrade.[ Topic should be how to insert non iso characters in iso1 character set Sybase Server ] Server Level: -  Use Sybase Server wide Setting or Session Level Setting :-  disable character set conversi == True  Or set char_convert off @ the session level  By using the parameter we have able to convert the special ASCII characters back to the correct values.  In the database , data is still stored as a garbled value, but by turning thisconversion off, we are able view the correct value of this garbled data in theapplication
title: Re:Text Data Corruption Post Sybase Upgrade to 15.5 from 12.5.4
job scheduler roles missing in ASE 16 dev. edition
text: Hi,First of all its seems useful to mention that I initially installed ASE 16 dev. edit. without job scheduler & SAP console as those components failed during the installation.After some good advice of helpful people in this community, I got some basic parts up & running and did a 1st effort on installing the job scheduler manually, based on the related users guide for v.15.7. I have the feeling that its current status seems to be more or less OK ; I judge that upon next facts :- ps -ef | grep -i ase :...sybpmc 4747 4730 0 16:18 ? 00:00:00 /sybase/pmc/ASE-16_0/bin/jsagent -p 4900 -n localhost -t 32 -l 0 -v -e /sybase/pmc/ASE-16_0/install/SLES_ASE_JSAGENT.log -i /sybase/pmc > /dev/null--> reference to jsagent & portnr. that I added to the interfaces file...- sp_displayroles doesn't show a "js*role" like e.g. js_admin_role- sp_jsconfigure seems to exist, but user sa in isql isn't authorised to use it because of missing js_admin_roleI have no problem with adding the missing "js*role" myself manually, but in that case the question is how & based on what ? If I would need to build roles in SAP ABAP systems, I'd have "underlying components" like e.g. activities as "building blocks".I checked these roles because the next part in the job scheduler users guide explains creating of users & assigning them to roles.Feel free to correct my way of thinking/handling this in case I'd be guilty on misinterpretations Thx,Joris
author: Joris Vercaigne
Joris Vercaigne
text: Hi,I clarified this yet partly myself related to js_admin_role & js_user_role ... it's a matter of using sp_displayroles completely & correctly Role js_sa_role isn't to be retrieved via sp_displayroles but it's mentioned in the job scheduler user guide. Any good advice on this would be welcome but I could also ignore that if it wouldn't bother in my future experiments for self-study.Joris
title: Re:job scheduler roles missing in ASE 16 dev. edition
ASE for Solaris x86
text: I really need a developers edition of ASE for Solaris x86. The current versions that are available are only for Linux or Windows. Is there anywhere I can get the Solaris x86 version??
author: Christopher Holderby
Mark A Parsons
text: You haven't mentioned which ASE version you're looking for so I'm going to assume a newer/recent version of ASE 15.7 is sufficient ...For quite awhile now all ASE downloads (IR, GA, EBF, SPxxx) have contained the entire code line (ie, you don't have to find a GA release and then apply a smaller/delta ebf patch file to get the latest version).If you've got access to the EBF downloads @ sybase.com you should be able to download a recent copy of ASE 15.7 for Solaris/x86. During installation just pick the developer license version (the install will generate a generic *lic file for the developers version).--------------While there may be a way to download the file from the SAP website(s), I wouldn't have a clue since a) the SAP websites are poorly-designed/confusing and b) SAP is clamping down pretty hard on what Sybase related downloads are available and to whom.

I am looking for a 32 bit open client version 15.7.it seems SAP doesn't provide a 32 bit ASE 15.7 for linux. Only 64 bit is available. I just need a 32 bit 15.7 client.Appreciate any feedbackThanks

text: Hi Loke, The 32 bit binaries are part of the 64 bit install for SDK (Software Developers Kit). There are a few differences though the .a files are not part of the 64 bit install but all the .so files are there. So if your application doesn't need .a you should be able to use the 64 bit SDK.Instructions for SDK for SAP ASE:The OpenClient for ASE is in the SDK (Software Developers Kit) for ASE.Click Software downloads & license keysClick the Download software tabClick the A-Z index on the left side of the screenClick the letter SClick the SDK for SAP ASE(You have a choice between 15.7 and 16.0) both are currentClick SDK for SAP ASE 16.0 or 15.7Click Support Packages and Patches on the right side of the screenClick on the platform you need (there is a linux x32 bit listed)If you want to compare the Bad Performance on Sybase ASE
text: Hi experts,we are planning to doing a migration from Oracle to Sybase ASE.At the moment we are having one productive ERP System on Oracle and one testing system on sybase ASE.If I do an select on the same table in Q and P, I have a big time difference.Which means, in Q-System it is very slow.At the moment I am trying to analyze the sybase, what is causig this problem.Can some provide me some tips.At the moment I am fighting with ST12.If I make an explain in ST12, I get the message "No matching plan cound be found in the procedure cache - use Runtime Explain". What does it mean or were can I check the execution plan for sybase ASE? Thank you
author: Christian Paminger
Mark A Parsons
text: Assumption: Q==Sybase, P==OracleNOTE: While I do work with Sybase ASE, I don't work with SAP applications so I've got no idea what 'ST12' is or what 'explain in ST12' means so fwiw ...In Sybase:- while the long running query is running ...- use another session (eg, isql) to log into Sybase with a login that has the 'sa_role' role and ...- run 'sp_who' to get the spid of the long running query and then ...- run 'sp_showplan <spid>' to show the query plan of the long running queryNOTE: The 'sa_role' role requirement is needed to run 'sp_showplan'.Understanding the query plan will depend on the complexity of the query, the current stats for the various referenced tables/indexes/columns, and optimizer-related configuration parameters.If you're unable to make sense of the query plan then I'd suggest you post back here with (to start with) the complete query and query plan (preferably as a *.txt attachment in order to maintain formatting).
title: Re:Bad Performance on Sybase ASE

author: János Czettler
text: Hi Christian,we have faced with similar problem with more sybase ase, with different sp levels. Usually system function which reading tadir, reposrc, eg. activation ddic elements, smartforms, etc...finally I found a note:1889090 - SYB: Activating smartform is taking too much time - TRDIRThis note said use "sp_recompile <tablename>" for use a new query plan for the select.Try this workaround, or use the latest ASE patch level - as said the note.Regards,Janos
title: Re:Bad Performance on Sybase ASE

author: Sang-Wook Han
text: Hi,Why don't you try to run update statistics for all ERP tables in ASE...that's my recommendation.Regards,sang-wook
title: Re:Bad Performance on Sybase ASE

author: János Czettler
text: Hi Sang-Wook,the ATM is configured from the beginning in or all ASE based ERP systems. So the automatic statistics update and the automatic table reorganization are running. There were not other database relevant performantce problems in the systems. Only when we activate a eg. function modul, smartform, or other DDIC objects... just during the system reading the table tadir (reposrc)....until when we applied the workaround from note 1889090.Regards,Janos
title: Re:Bad Performance on Sybase ASE

If it fails , a second search that is case-insensitive occurs) but in my case it is not performing case-insensitive search. I am attaching the document for your reference.http://infocenter.sybase.com/help/index.jsp?topic=/com.infocenter.dc20066.1570100/doc/html/san1364409576274.htmlThanks,Raman

Ryan Hansen

author: Dawn Kim
text: Hi Monica,Another thing you want to make sure is on your ASE that the oledb/adonet MDA scripts are up to snuff. Some of our fixes in the driver are in this.If you login into the ASE and get the output of sp_version.You should get something like this: OLEDB MDA Scripts 15.7.0.1250.1013/Wed Feb 19 UTC 00:28:47 2014The ado.net driver and the older oledb driver use some specific MDA scripts on the ASE.Read the coverletter of the SDK (Software Developers Kit for ASE). It explains how to update the MDA scripts. They are on the client side $sybase\ADONET\sp.So where you downloaded the SDK you want to click Info then look for the README.This is all the SDKs:* Updating the metadata stored procedures required by ODBC, OLE DB and  jConnect Drivers on Adaptive Server Enterprise Certain new features and bug fixes in ODBC, OLE DB and jConnect drivers  require you to modify the metadata stored procedures in Adaptive Server.  These stored procedures may not be up-to-date on your host ASE server due  to various reasons. If the metadata stored procedures are outdated, you may not be able to use  some of the fixes that are implemented in this SP/ESD, so you will need to  manually install the updated metadata stored procedures. To update the metadata stored procedures in Adaptive Server, first determine  the version of the meta-data scripts installed on the ASE. To do so, execute  the following command: sp_version go The version number of the ODBC, OLE DB and jConnect meta-data scripts will  be displayed. Review the version number column and compare it against the version of the  driver being used.  If the metadata scripts are outdated, the version installed will be older  than the driver build number or you will encounter one of the following: - stored procedure sp_version is not found - the stored procedure output does not print a row for the driver The updated scripts are included with the drivers and can be installed as  follows: For ODBC & OLE DB: - Go the "sp" directory under the ODBC/OLE DB installation directory - Execute the install_odbc_sprocs script for the ODBC Driver and  install_oledb_sprocs script for OLE DB Provider. Syntax for using the script is: install_[odbc/olebd]_sprocs <ServerName> <username> [<password>] where <ServerName> is the name of the Adaptive Server <username> is the username to connect to the server [<password>] is the password the username (dont supply this for null password) For jConnect: - Go to the "sp" directory under the jConnect installation directory. Based  on your host ASE server version, choose the appropriate SQL script.  - Use isql or another tool of your choice to execute the selected script.  This will install the current meta-data stored procedures.Thanks,Dawn

If I use GetOrdinal("C1_INT") I see failure:Hello from Getters, Version=1.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=nullProvider version loaded: 4.157.1250.0Exception: System.IndexOutOfRangeException: Column referenced (C1_INT) does not exist at Sybase.Data.AseClient1.AseDataReader.GetOrdinal(String name) at Sybase.Data.AseClient.AseDataReader.GetOrdinal(String name) at BestSamps.Program.Main(String[] args) in c:\Stuff\subcases\asenet\SCN\BestSamps\Getters\Program.cs:line 41If I use GetOrdinal("c1_int") it works:Hello from Getters, Version=1.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=nullProvider version loaded: 4.157.1250.0[This is the ordinal of c1_int]:c1 = 0c1: 1c2: ISUG Test 1c3: 1234.56c4: 2/17/2014 11:08:20 PMAt this point I am not sure if this is a document error or something wrong in the provider. Script for table reorg and update statistics
text: Hi All,Can anyone refer me to script(s) or stored procedure(s) for reorging and updating table statistics, which considers criteria for "best practices"?i.e. using info from systabstats, sysstatistics, datechange(), derived_stat(), sp_fragmentation, etc.I am thinking about writing my own, but would not like to re-invent if possible.Thanks,Mark
author: Mark Gearhart
Jason Froebe
text: Unfortunately, such code is usually locked under a customer's legal department regarding releasing 'home grown' code. I think if they could be written as stored procedures, they would be a great addition to Ed Barlow's stored procedures for ASE. I'm willing to help.
title: Re:Script for table reorg and update statistics

author: Mark Gearhart
text: Hi Jason,You are probably right. I haven't seen anything out there at all, and stuff in our company looks like it was written for ancient versions of ASE.I think I'll give it a try... and then check with our legal department... and then likely keep it internal forever... Mark
title: Re:Script for table reorg and update statistics

author: Kevin Sherlock
text: One shop's "best practices" might be overkill (or underkill) for yours. Storage hierarchies vary wildly. Query/transaction profiles are different (complex, to simple queries that may not need updated stats as much). My extremely flat table design might require different considerations from your highly normalized design. I might want to run 6 concurrent update stats jobs because I have 8 engines and I know that pushes my OS io limits, and my tempdb is a SSD, and my maintenance window is only 2 hours before another batch job starts. Yours might/will be different. etc.Best thing you can do is write your own for your environment taking into consideration a number of factors specific to your environment. You would also have to have a way to determine (or estimate) when it actually makes sense to update stats on a per table/index/colum basis, or settle for some kind of shotgun approach.Make use of parallel jobs/engines as much as it makes sense to.I've seen others use metrics from derived_stat() to determine threshold criteria. datachange() can be a fast way to determine which update stats table/index/column to skip, but you gotta lookout for the conditions that reset this reading between interations of your update stats jobs.Also, some of the cluster ratios returned by derived_stat() might be misleading until CR counts are updated by.... update stats. And oh, by the way, what is your setting for "sysstatistics flush interval"? That setting is disabled by default. Reading from derived_stat() and datachange() could be affected there.Lots of variabled to consider - probably explains the lack of a "general' rule-of-thumb type of script. It can probably be written to some level of satisfaction, but should also contain lots of "assumptions" and other variables that should be coded so that the DBA can tweak.
title: Re:Script for table reorg and update statistics
sp_helpsegment pages don't add up. How can I fix this?
text: I'm trying to use sp_helpsegment to determine how full the transaction log is. It seems one would expect 'used_pages' + 'free_pages' = 'total_pages'. However, this is not the case with my results. Am I misinterpreting the meaning of these fields, or is the data stale? If it is stale, is there some command I can run to refresh the data?
author: Dan Jaglowski
Mark A Parsons
text: Could you post the entire output from running:=================exec master..sp_helpdb <db_name>gouse <db_name>gosp_helpsegment logsegmentgo=================
title: Re:sp_helpsegment pages don't add up. How can I fix this?

author: Dan Jaglowski
text: Thanks Mark, See below:exec master..sp_helpdb mastergoname db_size owner dbid created durability lobcomplvl inrowlen statusmaster 26.0MB sa 1 Sep 10, 2013 full 0 NULL mixed log and datadevice_fragments size usage created free kbytesmaster 26.0MB data and log Sep 10 2013 4:40 PM 512device segmentmaster defaultmaster logsegmentmaster systemselect @@maxpagesizego4096

Separate roles for business and administrators in ASE
text: As more businesses move to the cloud, it is imperative to design infrastructure to be as secure as possible.The sa_role in ASE is used by administrators for the configuration of server parameters and the maintenance of databases.It is also able to create all database objects and read from all tables.I think it will be a good idea if this role is restricted such that it is unable to create objects or perform CRUD operations on database objects. This should be the domain of the business role.Does anyone have any ideas of this kind of feature in ASE?
author: Sebastian Ogeyingbo
Kevin Sherlock
text: When you are talking about logsegments it only makes sense to think of space in terms of reserved, and unreserved space. Here is a query I posted in the ASE for Custom Appplications forum. You can rewrite it for your purposes to cull out separate columns for "logsegment_freespace", "reserved_for_rollbacks", etc per row in sysusages. Replace "mydb" with your database name:select db_name(u.dbid) as "dbname",s.name,case u.segmapwhen 4 then str(lct_admin("logsegment_freepages", db_id('mydb')) - lct_admin("reserved_for_rollbacks", db_id('mydb')),12) else str(sum(curunreservedpgs(u.dbid, u.lstart, u.unreservedpgs)),12)end as "unreserved_pgs"from master..sysdevices dinner join master..sysusages uon d.vdevno = u.vdevnoinner join syssegments son u.segmap & power(2,s.segment) != 0where u.dbid = db_id('mydb')and d.status & 2 = 2group by db_name(u.dbid),s.name,u.segmapgo
title: Re:sp_helpsegment pages don't add up. How can I fix this?

author: Mark A Parsons
text: To limit access to data you could look at using ASE's Encrypted Columns feature.One of the benefits of this feature is exactly what you're looking for ... disabling logins with sa_role from accessing business data.Just keep in mind:- this feature requires an additional licen$e- implementation/management of this feature will require more effort, potential performance degradation (if not implemented properly), and additional responsibility for more people (eg, different people to manage encryption keys)
title: Re:Separate roles for business and administrators in ASE

author: Mark A Parsons
text: Your logsegment is sitting on the same device as the default/system segments (this is *normal* for the master database).When you have log and data mixed on a device (see the 'mixed log and data' clause in the sp_helpdb output), then you'll get what appears to be some strange/funky values in the output of sp_helpsegment. The primary issue is that some of the pages will be in use by other segments, so those pages will be missing from the sp_helpsegment output.In your case:- total size = 26MB = this is the total size of the all the disk fragments that your logsegment is sitting on (which happens to be the entire 'master' device fragment in use by the master database)- total pages = 6656 = 26MB / 4K (page size), ie, just another way of saying 26MB- free pages = 128 = amount of space left on the devices that the logsegment resides on; in this case sp_helpdb is showing that you only have 512KB of space left on the master device (512K / 4K page size = 128 pages)- used pages = 3315 = amount of pages actually in use by the logsegmentSoooo, for this particular case the numbers look ok.As for the 3315 pages in use by the logsegment ... I'd suggest you 'dump transaction master with truncate_only' and then consider taking a database dump of the master database.Going forward you'll want a regularly scheduled job that periodically truncates the log (to keep your master database from filling up). My preference would be a threshold on the master/logsegment segment that automatically truncs the log when the threshold is crossed.
title: Re:sp_helpsegment pages don't add up. How can I fix this?

author: Bret Halford
text: Yes, this is why ASE 15.7 ESD 2 introduced the new Granular Permissions feature, which allows such permissions to be granted to logins and user defined roles, and revoked from sa_role. See http://infocenter.sybase.com/help/topic/com.sybase.infocenter.dc01165.1572/doc/html/mas1337275700545.html-bret
title: Re:Separate roles for business and administrators in ASE

author: Sebastian Ogeyingbo
text: Thanks Bret, most appreciated.- Sebastian
title: Re:Separate roles for business and administrators in ASE
How to create additional Adaptive Server and Backup Server?
text: Hi experts,I installed ASE 15.7 Developer Edition for Linux x86_64 on my RHEL 6.4 box using command line. After installation completed, I was able to create a default Adaptive Server "VM_01_S1" and its Backup Server "VM_01_S1_BS".Now I'm wondering how I can create additional Adaptive Server and Backup Server (say "VM_01_S2" and "VM_01_S2_BS") using the the same installation in command line. Also I'd like to create them with 8K page size (for the default one I used 4K page size).Could you please shed some light on this?
author: Jerry Wang
Ryan Hansen
text: Hi Jerry,You can build additional servers at:$SYBASE/$SYBASE_ASE/bin./srvbuildMake sure you have xwindows open and you set the DISPLAY environment variable(Example- start Exceed on Windows, setenv DISPLAY 10.168.131.229:0.0)I don't see an option to change a backup server's page size.You may want to post this in:SAP Applications on SAP Adaptive Server Enterprise (SAP ASE)This site is more for connectivity questions.Regards,Ryan
title: Re:How to create additional Adaptive Server and Backup Server?

author: Jerry Wang
text: Hi Ryan,Thanks for your reply. Since I didn't install GUI support on my RHEL 6.4, I cannot use "srvbuild" at all.However, I was able to use "srvbuildres" utility with resource file to create additional Adaptive Server and Backup Server. I reused and modified the resource files generated by the initial setup for "VM_01_S1" and "VM_01_S1_BS", so that I can create "VM_01_S2" and "VM_01_S2_BS" with 8K page size.
title: Re:How to create additional Adaptive Server and Backup Server?
First SP execution slow after insert many datas
text: Hi community,My ASE version is 12.5.4 ESD9I have a little problem with the SP execution.I am executing one SP during all the day and the time result is 6ms more or less. The problem appear after insert many datas in the ASE (insert system statistics of the day).This the normal result of the day:00:00 a 01:00 el resultado el tiempo del procedimiento almacenado es de 6 ms 01:00-1:30 eliminar muchas lneas de la BBDD. 1:30-03:00 insercin muchas lneas de la BBDD 03:00-23:59 La primera ejecucin tiene un resultado tiempo que 13000ms y la ejecucin del resto de la jornada, la duracin del procedimiento es normal, 6msMy first idea was increase the "procedure cache size" and now the sp_monitoconfig i have 55% on "Pct_act".Any idea?In the sysmon result, i have the following recommendation in "Data Cache Management": Tuning Recommendations for Data cache : default data cache  -------------------------------------  - Consider using 'relaxed LRU replacement policy' for this cache. - Consider adding a large I/O pool for this cache.Could be this the reason?Thanks in advance,David
author: David Jimenez
Mark A Parsons
text: 1 - I wouldn't worry about the sysmon suggestions at this point.2 - How many rows are being inserted? How many rows are in the table? Are you truncating the table before inserting the rows?3 - Have you tried running 'update index statistics' for each table after you've completed loading data?4 - What do you do (if anything) to get the performance back to normal? Or does it run fast after the first slow run?If the proc runs quickly on the second and successive runs then my guess would be that the data load is pushing a lot of data out of cache ... data that your proc relies on. So the first time you run the proc (after the data load) you're having to wait for all of your data to be pulled back into memory.After you've loaded the data, and before you run your proc again, you could try wrapping the proc call in some commands to grab some performance metrics:=====================-- if you have monitoring enabled the before/after records from-- monProcessActivity can give you a high-level view of your-- cpu and disk performance metrics during the run; you'll-- need 'mon_role' access to query monProcessActivityselect * from master..monProcessActivity where SPID = @@spidgoset showplan onset statistics io,time ongoexec <proc> .....goselect * from master..monProcessActivity where SPID = @@spidgo=====================You'll probably want to direct the output to a file, especially if the proc has a large volume of passes through any looping constructs (eg, while ...). If the output shows high volumes of disk IOs then that would tend to validate my assumption (about your data being pushed out of cache).Addressing this performance issue would require knowing a bit more about your system, eg:- how big is the cache that you're loading data against- how is said cache configured- how much data are you loading- how much data is your proc trying to access on each run- are you giving the proc a different set of input parameters each time it's run- how often do you run the proc- and on and on and on ...
title: Re:First SP execution slow after insert many datas

author: Mark A Parsons
text: Another possibility ...1 - You run the proc regularly enough during the day that a compiled copy remains in procedure cache thus eliminating the need to recompile the proc for your regular executions.2 - You cease running the proc for an extended period of time leading up and including the time during which you're loading data.3 - The first time you run the proc (after loading the data) the proc has to be read from disk and compiled.This of course assumes that it takes upwards of 13secs to comiple the proc (quite possible with ASE 15.x, less likely ... though not impossible ... in ASE 12.5.4).To see if the above describes your situation you can try the following at any time that's convenient for you:=================exec <proc> <argument_list> with recompilego=================This will force the proc to recompile the next time it's run. If your 13sec delay (after the data load) is due to having to compile the proc then this call example should also take ~13secs to complete.
title: Re:First SP execution slow after insert many datas
Creation of Adaptive Server Sybase 15.7 WinXP sp3 - "No network connection"

Add protocol ? Connection info ?Default XP Server ? user ? connection info ?Is there any document which gives help, I tried to search but could not,Please help me over "no network connection "
author: Alex Knight
Mark A Parsons
text: What's the *exact* version of ASE 15.7 you're trying to install? Are you running XP Home or XP Professional?15.7 is not supported on XP Home.As of 15.7 ESD #2, support for XP Professional has been dropped. You can install the product but the server binaries (backupserver, dataserver) will fail to start up due to a missing network-related module/dll (said module/dll is only available in newer versions of the Windows OS, eg, 2008, Windows 7).Without more details about your ASE and XP versions I'm going to guess the dataserver creation failed due to the inability to startup the dataserver binary, which in turn is due to the missing network-related module/dll, ie, you're trying to install/run ASE 15.7 ESD 2+ on an unsupported version of Windows.

Can I use the SAP Sybase ODBC driver in ASE SDK 15.7 to connect to ASE 12.5.3 ESD#7?
text: Im trying to connect to an instance of Adaptive ServerEnterprise/12.5.3/EBF 13325 ESD#7/P/Sun_svr4/OS 5.8/ase1253/1951/64-bit/FBO/FriMar 24 11:00:22 2006 using ODBC. Can Iuse the ODBC driver provided with SDK 15.7 or should I use and early version ofthe SDK?
author: Uvernes Somarriba
Ryan Hansen
text: Hi Uvernes Somarriba,This is something that isn't tested as ASE 12.5.3 was EOL before SDK 15.7.We do have some customers using old ASEs with newer clients.This might work depending on what you are doing.Here is what you need to do before testing.Update the MDA scripts.These scripts might not be installed on the ASE currently as it is an older version.However these MDA scripts keep the SDK drivers compatible with the ASEs.To see what version of scripts are currently installed isql into the ASE.run command:sp_versionAt the top of the output you should see:ODBC MDA Scripts xx.x.x.xxx/dateIf this command fails then there are no scripts currently installed.To keep the Driver compatible with the ASE the scripts must be >= the driver used.To update/create the scripts a batch job is used.This batch job is located in $SYBASE/DataAccess/ODBC/spinstall_odbc_sprocsExample of running this:install_odbc_sprocs <sql.ini entry> sa <password>To update my server I use-install_odbc_sprocs solex sa sybaseThis will install the scripts on the ASE.When running sp_version again it should output the new version.These scripts are backward compatible.Once this is done you can test the ODBC driver against ASE 12.5.3.Let me know if you have questions.Regards,Ryan
title: Re:Can I use the SAP Sybase ODBC driver in ASE SDK 15.7 to connect to ASE 12.5.3 ESD#7?

author: Uvernes Somarriba
text: Thanks a lot Ryan, will test and get back with the resutls.

specified file 'dump devices' is out of sequence?
text: i was getting error message while processing load transaction in sybase ase server,below i mentioned commands and errors for above error1> load transaction new_db2> from "C:\Sybase\BK\newdb_trbk.dmp"3> goBackup Server session id is: 76. Use this value when executing the'sp_volchanged' system stored procedure after fulfilling any volume changerequest from the Backup Server.Backup Server: 6.28.1.1: Dumpfile name 'new_db1326004A5A ' section number 1mounted on disk file 'C:\Sybase\BK\newdb_trbk.dmp'Msg 4305, Level 16, State 1:Server 'Sybase', Line 1:Specified file 'dump device' is out of sequence. Current time stamp is Sep 172013 5:17:14:923AM while dump was from Sep 17 2013 4:51:14:743AM.kindly help me to find solution for above problem?
author: SelvaKumar Kuppusamy
Gaurav Sinha
text: Hi SelvaKumar,There are one or more transaction log backups that need to be restored before the current transaction log backup.Load the log backups in the same sequence in which they were made. Check your transaction log dumps to determine whether one was loaded out of order. If you find the correct dump, load it and continue with the rest of the dumps, in order. Please note - If you are missing a transaction log dump, you can only restore up to the transaction log dump before the missing dump.
title: Re:specified file 'dump devices' is out of sequence?

author: SelvaKumar Kuppusamy
text: Hi Gaurav sir, To take log backup , some databases i am using separate log devices , in that log devices only particular database transactions will overwrite.so no need to take backup in sequence order is it correct sir?
title: Re:specified file 'dump devices' is out of sequence?

author: Mark A Parsons
text: You haven't provided any details on how you generate your dump files nor how you derive your load command so the following may (not) apply in your situation ...Your example load command references a dump file named: "C:\Sybase\BK\newdb_trbk.dmp"If your dump commands also dump to this same file name, then successive dumps will overwrite the previous dump file. In this scenario, when you try to load the file, you will get the aforementioned error about the dump file being out of sequence.To get around this issue your best bet is to include a datetime stamp in the dump file names when dumping. [I also add the dataserver and database names to the dump file name to help insure uniqueness - comes in handy when you've got many dataservers and databases.] In my environments the dump file names are formatted like ...<DS>.<DB>.YYYYMMDD.HHMMSS.{dbdump|logdump}NOTE: HHMMSS is in 24-hour formatThe following shows the series of dump file names where the database is dumped @ 23:30, and logs are dumped every 15 minutes:MyASE.mydb.20130916.233003.dbdumpMyASE.mydb.20130916.234502.logdumpMyASE.mydb.20130917.000006.logdumpMyASE.mydb.20130917.001503.logdump....MyASE.mydb.20130917.233002.dbdumpMyASE.mydb.20130917.234517.logdump
title: Re:specified file 'dump devices' is out of sequence?

author: Jason Froebe
text: Sybase ASE Cluster edition is a response by Sybase (pre-SAP) to Oracle's RAC clustering. ASE Cluster edition allows you to run ASE on multiple systems in tandem. It does not provide high availability but individual ASE instances (nodes) can be taken offline. It started off strong but interest in it tapered off. Whether it will still be marketed and developed depends on SAP. ASE (non-cluster edition) is a RDMS that runs as a single entity. While it can communicate with other RDBMSs with proxy tables, databases, procedures, message queues (e.g. MQ Series), the communication is very limited. ASE can be tied with another instance using hardware/os based high availability.
title: Re:Difference between Sybase Cluster Edition And ASE

author: Mark A Parsons
text: Correct me if I'm wrong ... it looks like you performed the following:1 - dump database2 - dump transaction3 - update table/column4 - load transaction (load dump file from step #2)Why are you trying to load the transaction dump file from step #2?If your intent is to recover back to the point just before the update (step #3), then you have to go back to your most recent *database* dump (step #1) and load it (via 'load database') and then follow-up with all the transaction log dumps taken afterwards (step #2) (via load transaction).
title: Re:specified file 'dump devices' is out of sequence?

author: Mark Kusma
text: Jason,For ASE Cluster Edition, you wrote, "It does not provide high availability", however, that is exactly what ASE CE provides. As long as the application is coded to request extended HA failover, it will failover to a surviving instance/node. Mark
title: Re:Difference between Sybase Cluster Edition And ASE

author: SelvaKumar Kuppusamy
text: Thank you very much mark , last night i was perfectly done my backup and recovery practice but i eagerly waited for your reply ,thank you so much .
title: Re:specified file 'dump devices' is out of sequence?

author: Jason Froebe
text: Thanks Mark for the correction. This is what happens when I write something up quick after a meeting. Nomenclature at different places. ugh.I meant disaster recovery not high availability. You could presumably perform a disk level replication (e.g. SRDF, PPRC) or Replication Server but with the small number of ASE cluster installs I wouldn't trust such a DR setup without extensive testing.
title: Re:Difference between Sybase Cluster Edition And ASE
ASE 15.5/Win7 ODBC Connectivity Problems
text: We recently upgraded from WinXp/Sybase 11 client to Win7/ASE 15.5 client (32-bit). We run queries against Sybase databases from MS Access 2010 (32-bit). Since the upgrade 3 weeks ago, we've had chronic problems with ODBC connections (DSNs built using odbcad32.dll in SysWow64 folder). Overrode the following defaults when building the DSN (login timout to 0; doubled buffer pool and fetch array size parameters). ODBC links work normally when any Access database is initially opened, but within 10-15 minutes running queries lose their ODBC connection ("ODBC--lost connection to <DSN name>" message), or multiple ODBC signon prompts come up for subsequent activity against the same ODBC link/query. Closing/reopening the Access database resolves the problem temporarily.PC Support installed an EBF 2 weeks ago, and things worked normally for 2 days, but then the connectivity problems resurfaced. I've been assured that the EBF is still on my computer. Any thoughts?
author: Jim Drosdahl
Ryan Hansen
text: Hi Jim,I would suggest upgrading to 15.7 SP100 or wait for SDK 15.7 SP110 that will be released soon.There were bugs reported in earlier releases with Access.The ones that I can think of off the top of my head are:1. Timeouts causing login boxes to pop up multiple times. This can be fixed through an Access registry change This is caused by their connectiontimeout HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Wow6432Node\Microsoft\Office\14.0\Access Connectivity Engine\Engines\ODBCconnection Timeout = 600 defaultconnection Timeout = 0 will cause the connection to last until Access is closed.2. Multiple logins causing users to be locked out This is a bug and you will have to upgrade to get around this. Fixed in SDK 15.7 SP100.When upgrading you will need to relink your tables so the connection string is recreated.You will also want to make sure your ASE has the correct MDA scripts installed.You can check to see what is installed by using the ASE command:sp_versionIf the ODBC MDA script output is less than what you are using, you will need to upgrade the MDA scripts on the ASE.You can do this on the SDK client install.cd $SYBASE/DataAccess/ODBC/spinstall_odbc_sprocs <sql.ini ASE entry name> <username: sa> <password>example-install_odbc_sprocs solex sa sybaseAfter running this check your ASE again to make sure the MDA scripts were upgraded:sp_versionThese scripts are backward compatible and have bug fixes in them.Access is notorious for needing the scripts upgraded.Suggestions:- upgrade the MDA scripts on ASE if the client version is using a newer ODBC.- try to use the connect timeout registry change. If this works then you don't need to upgrade.- upgrade to SDK 15.7 Sp100 and relink your tablesRegards,Ryan
title: Re:ASE 15.5/Win7 ODBC Connectivity Problems

author: Jim Drosdahl
text: Ryan,I made the registry change for the connectiontimeout and it seems to have fixed the 'multiple signon prompt' issue. I'm waiting now for our Support guy to take care of SDK 15.7 SP100 upgrade and the MDA script issue.Will post a response as soon as we've completed these tasks.Thanks,Jim
title: Re:ASE 15.5/Win7 ODBC Connectivity Problems

author: Jim Drosdahl
text: Ryan,I've marked your answer as 'Correct answer' because I've been informed by our Sybase DBA that upgrading the MDA scripts at this point will require changes to stored procedures that will negatively impact other critical apps, so it looks like we'll be living with the known bugs for a while longer.Thanks for your assistance,Jim
title: Re:ASE 15.5/Win7 ODBC Connectivity Problems

author: Ryan Hansen
text: Hi Jim,Just an FYI, upgrading the MDA scripts is a suggestion to keep the ODBC driverfrom causing further issues and keeping it compatible with ASE.This isn't apart of the specific Access fix you are running into.Glad this worked for you,Ryan
title: Re:ASE 15.5/Win7 ODBC Connectivity Problems

Static library for Sybase CT library (Windows, Linux)
text: Dear Friends,I am upgrading a C++ application to read data from Sybase ASE (15.7) database on Windows and Linux.After going thru Sybase manuals, I found that open client (CT) library can be used to communicate with ASE DB server.Is this library available for static linking into C++ executable? Or is the CT library source code available for compiling into the executable?A Sybase page (http://infocenter.sybase.com/help/index.jsp?topic=/com.sybase.infocenter.dc35455.1500/html/ocspw95/ocspw9510.htm) refers to libsybct.lib, which is an import lib to load corresponding dll, but I did not find more details on static version of this library.Thanks in advance for your help and timeBest Regards.
author: Ganesh Borse
Simon Ogden
text: Hi,We do provide static libraries and shared libraries on Unix\Linux (I think with ASE and SDK), you'll find them in $SYBASE/OCS-15_0/lib.If you are on Windows though, you need to link dynamically and use the dlls at runtime.HTH,Simon
title: Re:Static library for Sybase CT library (Windows, Linux)

author: Paul Vero
text: Hi,As Simon mentions for Linux/UNIX both static and shared libs are provided.Your best bet is to become familiar with the samples. On Linux, for example, check out the $SYBASE/OCS-15_0/sample/ctlibrary directoryCheck the sybopts.sh file for sample compile/link lines for various platforms and whether you want threaded or non-threaded. You start out deciding if you want non-threaded or threaded.Keep in mind I am doing this with the SDK 15.7 x64 version on Linux (32 bit libraries install only with the non threaded static/shared libs, for threaded only the shared libs are included).So, for 64-bit if you want to build static non-threaded:setenv SYBPLATFORM linux64I modify sybopts.sh: linuxamd64 | linux64) CC="gcc"; CFLAGS="-m64 -g -DSYB_LP64 -Wall -Wformat=2 -Wl,-Bstatic"; BLKLIB="-lsybblk64"; SRVLIB="-lsybsrv64"; CTLIB="-lsybct64"; COMLIBS="-lsybtcl64 -lsybcs64 -lsybcomn64 -lsybintl64 -lsybunic64"; SYSLIBS="-Wl,-Bdynamic -ldl -lnsl -lm" ;;Then run make firstappldd firstapp libdl.so.2 => /lib64/libdl.so.2 (0x0000003e3ce00000) libnsl.so.1 => /lib64/libnsl.so.1 (0x0000003e40a00000) libm.so.6 => /lib64/libm.so.6 (0x0000003e3ca00000) libc.so.6 => /lib64/libc.so.6 (0x0000003e3c600000) /lib64/ld-linux-x86-64.so.2 (0x0000003e3c200000)[I leave the system libs as dynamic]If I run the make with modified sybopts.sh (removing -Wl,-Bstatic)ldd firstapp: libsybct64.so => /sybase/ocs/syb157/OCS-15_0/lib/libsybct64.so (0x00002aaaaaaad000) libsybtcl64.so => /sybase/ocs/syb157/OCS-15_0/lib/libsybtcl64.so (0x00002aaaaad48000) libsybcs64.so => /sybase/ocs/syb157/OCS-15_0/lib/libsybcs64.so (0x00002aaaaaf6f000) libsybcomn64.so => /sybase/ocs/syb157/OCS-15_0/lib/libsybcomn64.so (0x00002aaaab183000) libsybintl64.so => /sybase/ocs/syb157/OCS-15_0/lib/libsybintl64.so (0x00002aaaab441000) libsybunic64.so => /sybase/ocs/syb157/OCS-15_0/lib/libsybunic64.so (0x00002aaaab64a000) libdl.so.2 => /lib64/libdl.so.2 (0x0000003e3ce00000) libnsl.so.1 => /lib64/libnsl.so.1 (0x0000003e40a00000) libm.so.6 => /lib64/libm.so.6 (0x0000003e3ca00000) libc.so.6 => /lib64/libc.so.6 (0x0000003e3c600000) /lib64/ld-linux-x86-64.so.2 (0x0000003e3c200000)On the threaded side, similar deal. I actually make a copy of the section (I think I made additions to accomodate my gcc compiler on the linux machine I use): nthread_linuxamd64 | nthread_linux64) CC="cc"; CFLAGS="-m64 -g -DSYB_LP64 -D_REENTRANT -Werror -Wall -Wformat=2"; BLKLIB="-lsybblk_r64"; SRVLIB="-lsybsrv_r64"; CTLIB=-lsybct_r64; COMLIBS="-lsybtcl_r64 -lsybcs_r64 -lsybcomn_r64 -lsybintl_r64 -lsybunic64"; SYSLIBS="-Wl,-Bdynamic -ldl -lpthread -lnsl -lm" ;;I create a new section: nthread_linuxamd64_static | nthread_linux64_static) CC="cc"; CFLAGS="-m64 -g -DSYB_LP64 -D_REENTRANT -Werror -Wall -Wformat=2 -Wl,-Bstatic"; BLKLIB="-lsybblk_r64"; SRVLIB="-lsybsrv_r64"; CTLIB=-lsybct_r64; COMLIBS="-lsybtcl_r64 -lsybcs_r64 -lsybcomn_r64 -lsybintl_r64 -lsybunic64"; SYSLIBS="-Wl,-Bdynamic -ldl -lpthread -lnsl -lm" ;;setenv SYBPLATFORM nthread_linux64_staticmake firstappldd firstapp libdl.so.2 => /lib64/libdl.so.2 (0x0000003e3ce00000) libpthread.so.0 => /lib64/libpthread.so.0 (0x0000003e3d200000) libnsl.so.1 => /lib64/libnsl.so.1 (0x0000003e40a00000) libm.so.6 => /lib64/libm.so.6 (0x0000003e3ca00000) libc.so.6 => /lib64/libc.so.6 (0x0000003e3c600000) /lib64/ld-linux-x86-64.so.2 (0x0000003e3c200000)I don't know if it is advantageous to build static other than for deployment reasons, however, if you need to update client library you must rebuild the application to use the new libraries. On dynamic builds an update of client library provides access to the new libraries.For Windows, I don't think there really is a concept of static libraries since you use DLLs (as Simon points out). You do link to the libsybct.lib, etc in your application project but the application accesses the DLLs during runtime. I don't think we provide a static windows library for client library functions.Cheers,-Paul
title: Re:Static library for Sybase CT library (Windows, Linux)

author: Ganesh Borse
text: Hi FriendsGuidelines provided by you are really great and helpful.After comparing programming with ODBC and Sybase native (CT) libraries, I understood that native libs would require more configuration than ODBC. Also, I already have ODBC framework incorporated for MSSQL in our application.I have decided to use ODBC for accessing ASE server. Many thanks for your guidance.Best Regards
title: Re:Static library for Sybase CT library (Windows, Linux)

author: Paul Vero
text: Hi Ganesh,Sounds good. I know a lot about the ASE ODBC Driver. What sort of application? Customer C/C++ or framework on top of ODBC API?Cheers,-Paul
title: Re:Static library for Sybase CT library (Windows, Linux)
How to enable RSA encryption in client using CT-Library
text: Hi.We are using Sybase CT Library in our application to connect to the Sybase ASE and Sybase Rep Server. We require to support the RSA encrytion enabled at the ASE Server as shown below:1> sp_configure 'net password encrypt',2 We have enabled the encryption parameter in the client application but somehow it fails.If we set this parameter to 1, our applications connects without any issues1> sp_configure 'net password encrypt',1 Please let me know what else is required in CT Library to make this connection successful.Thanks,Satya
author: satya gupta
Mark Kusma
text: Hi Satya,How have you enabled it in the client application? Did you set CS_SEC_EXTENDED_ENCRYPTION on for the connection or something else?The sp_configure option of 1 tells ASE to accept the standard encryption if RSA is not available.It is designed for moving to RSA since it allows clients that haven't been upgraded to still connect. Setting the option to 2 indicates that clients must connect with RSA or they fail. Based on your results, it seems that the client is not using RSA and that is why it only connects under option 1.You need to have Open Client 15.0 ESD7 or later to set CS_SEC_EXTENDED_ENCRYPTION.Regards,Mark Kusma
title: Re:How to enable RSA encryption in client using CT-Library

author: satya gupta
text: Thanks Mark!It helped. I was actually looking at an older version of CT Reference Guide.Regards,Satya
title: Re:How to enable RSA encryption in client using CT-Library

ASE 15.7 FillFactor on DOL?
text: in ASE 15.7 how do you get fillfactor to work on the base table?
author: Cory Sane
Stefan Krause-Lichtenberg
text: Hello Cory,fillfactor used with DOL is different than on APL data pages:"Reducing index maintenance".. Clustered index: On an allpages-locked table, the fillfactor is applied to the data pages.On a data-only-locked table, the fillfactor is applied to the leaf pages of the index, and the data pages are fully packed (unless sp_chgattribute has been used to store a fillfactor for the table)...The chapter "Setting Space Management Properties" is a good resource to start with if you would like to get more details about reducing table / index maintenance.Hope this will help.Regards,Stefan
title: Re:ASE 15.7 FillFactor on DOL?

author: Cory Sane
text: Stefan,I have read those pages many times in the last 24 hours.I have used sp_chgattribute for the base table as you have documented in your second bullet point.I have not been able to affect the base table with "create clustered index","reorg rebuild" or "alter table lock".I have a 4k i/o page ASE Server... if I insert 32770 rows with 800 fixed bytes each.. I get 6554 datapages according to sp__optdiag. I use 'sp_chgattribute mytable, "fillfactor",80'... After "some process" I should get 8193 pages. This does not happen with any cmd that I have tried.Cory SaneCertified Sybase ASE 15.0 Administor Associate Certified Sybase ASE 15.0 SQL Developer ProfessionalMember of www.TeamSybase.com
title: Re:ASE 15.7 FillFactor on DOL?

author: Cory Sane
text: I have created a case with the ASE support team.I now have a definitive answer.I created a table with a row size that allowed only 5 rows to an disk page.I then used the fillfactor option to reduce the row count to 80% expecting only 4 rows per page.With the help of Abdelhak, It was discovered that the fillfactor option only stops after a row passes the percentage threshold. In my scenario, my first four rows only filled the page to 79% full so it allowed the last row to be inserted. The better way to show that fillfactor worked was to use 10 rows per page and to use a fillfactor of 78%. I have learned that fillfactor does work with big rows.
title: Re:ASE 15.7 FillFactor on DOL?

author: Chris Jones
text: Fillfactor is a bit of a strange beast. It's not really designed to faciliate how many rows you get per page. it does define how full a page will be - i.e. when you rebuild a table. However it's quite likey to change over time - though this does depend on how you are modifying data.Why are you trying to set the fillfactor?
title: Re:ASE 15.7 FillFactor on DOL?
