SYBASE DATABASE is not starting
text: Hi Experts,I am new to Sybase database. We are having PI installed on SYBASE database. I am trying to start the databse, Can you please suggest me.in /sybase/<SID>/ASE-15_0/install/ SID.log its showing below error.00:0006:00000:00001:2014/12/06 11:16:18.10 server Database 'sybsystemprocs' is now online.00:0006:00000:00012:2014/12/06 11:16:18.11 kernel Connectivity Library (Directory Control Layer) Error: Error returned by service provider.00:0006:00000:00012:2014/12/06 11:16:18.11 kernel Connectivity Library (Directory Control Layer) Error: (InterfacesDriver):Requested server name not found.00:0006:00000:00012:2014/12/06 11:16:18.11 kernel Server RUN_<SID> not registered in the interfaces file or directory services.00:0006:00000:00012:2014/12/06 11:16:18.11 kernel Cannot start any network listeners.00:0006:00000:00012:2014/12/06 11:16:18.11 kernel ueshutdown: exiting00:0000:00000:00000:2014/12/06 11:16:18.11 kernel Main thread performing final shutdown.00:0000:00000:00000:2014/12/06 11:16:18.16 kernel Blocking call queue shutdown.00:0000:00000:00000:2014/12/06 11:16:18.26 kernel SySAM: Checked in license for 4 ASE_ASM (2014.1231/permanent/1296 8FE3 0A83 A167).Please suggest me where I need to check to resolve the issue and make the database up & runningRegards,Manoj
author: Vamshi Reddy
Mark Kusma
text: Hi Manoj,From this message here, it seems the server name is not defined in the interfaces file:Requested server name not found.Server RUN_<SID> not registered in the interfaces file or directory servicesPerhaps when you started ASE, the server name was incorrectly specified, so check the -s parameter on your dataserver command line. Also check the interfaces file at /sybase/<SID>/interfaces. There should be an entry for <SID> like the following:MFK master tcp ether gts 4901 query tcp ether gts 4901Regards,Mark
title: Re:SYBASE DATABASE is not starting

author: Srinivasan Vinayagam
text: Hi Manoj,What is the OS?check environment variables if not set run SYBASE.env file.Also follow Mark answer.Regards,V Srinivasan
title: Re:SYBASE DATABASE is not starting

author: Bret Halford
text: Hi Manoj,How exactly are you trying to start the server?Typically this is done using "startserver -f RUN_<servername>" in $SYBASE/ASE-*/installi.e. if your ASE server in named BOB, there is a file in the install directory named RUN_BOB.The file contains a call to the dataserver binary passing parameters including -d for the masterdevice and -S for the server name ("BOB")It is also possible to start the server by executing dataserver (with the appropriate parameters) directly from the command line or OS boot-time directories. (note that using startserver causes ASE to run under "nohup", so that it doesn't come down if the terminal window it was started under is closed).Your errorlog entry, though, looks like the server is trying to start with the name of a RUN_SERVER file as the server name instead of just the server name. i.e. it is as if you had executeddataserver -d my_master_device -S RUN_<SID> ...instead ofdataserver -d my_master_device -S <SID>So please look closely at what you are doing when starting the server.-bret
title: Re:SYBASE DATABASE is not starting

Shrink or Eliminate a Database Device Sybase 15.5
text: Using Sybase v15.5Added a device of 5GB's but meant it to be 50MB'sExtended a BLOB field to that segment.I was able to drop the segment, however, cannot drop the device or even reduce it's size.I've found many articles but nothing with clear instructions and most say this is not possible.Has anyone done this successfully? Yes/NoIf "yes" - please describe stepsIf "no" - any alternatives?Thanks.
author: Shaun St Louis
Shaun St Louis
text: In addition...trying to drop the device tells me it's in use by the database.I see in the sysusages table that it has a segmap value of "0". Does this mean I can use the OS (HP-UX) to simply delete the file and regain the HD space?use master goselect * from sysusages wheredbid=db_id("abe")godbid, segmap, lstart, size, vstart, pad, unreservedpgs, crdate, vdevno4, 3, 0, 76800, 0, , 742, 2012-02-10 19:40:36.373, 94, 8, 76800, 51200, 0, , 0, 2012-02-10 19:40:36.373, 104, 16, 128000, 102400, 0, , 39799, 2012-02-10 19:40:36.373, 114, 4, 230400, 51200, 0, , 51000, 2012-02-10 19:40:36.373, 124, 8, 281600, 51200, 0, , 4552, 2012-02-10 19:40:36.373, 154, 3, 332800, 51200, 0, , 8, 2012-02-10 19:40:36.373, 134, 8, 384000, 51200, 0, , 0, 2012-02-10 19:40:36.373, 144, 3, 435200, 51200, 0, , 21731, 2012-02-10 19:40:36.373, 164, 8, 486400, 51200, 0, , 24632, 2012-08-22 20:28:24.03, 174, 0, 537600, 2560000,0, , 2550000, 2014-12-04 19:49:23.513, 18segmap 8 is index 7 is data and log 3 is data only 4 is log only  16 is blob (user defined) 0 is an error and the space will not be used unless other action is taken, such as extend or add segment. This one had me wondering as I have not seen a segmap of 0 before. After reviewing what Shawn executed we have determined it is because the default and system segments, which are automatically created on a new device, we dropped using sp_dropsegment.
title: Re:Shrink or Eliminate a Database Device Sybase 15.5

author: Mark A Parsons
text: If there's an entry in sysusages then that portion of the device is allocated to the database. Simply deleting the device at the OS level will cause database corruption because ASE will be looking for the device fragment(s) specified in sysusages, but will be unable to find the device out in the OS.segmap=0 means there are no segments sitting on said disk fragment; this means no new/future space will be allocated on that disk fragment. If the fragment had been in use before (eg, space allocated from the fragment) then said allocation may still be valid/in-use on the fragment (removing segments from a fragment does not necessarily remove the already allocated pages from the fragment).--------------In your case it appears that the last fragment does not have anything allocated on it (2,560,000 pages will require 10,000 ALLOCATION pages, thus leaving 2,550,000 available pages aka unreservedpgs pages).Shrinking databases isn't officially supported until sometime in ASE 15.7, having said that, since you don't have anything allocated on the last fragment you can try the following:NOTE: Perform the following at a time when you can bounce the dataserver.1 - backup the database (dump database)2 - configure direct updates of system tables (sp_configure 'allow update',1)3 - get a snapshot of the current rows in sysusages (select * from sysusages where dbid = db_id('abe'))4 - delete the last row in sysusages for the 'abe' database:=====================use mastergobegin trango-- delete only the last rowdelete sysusages where dbid = db_id('abe') and lstart = 537600-- should get message that 1 row was affectedgo-- make sure only the last row was deleteselect * from sysusages where dbid = deb_id('abe')go-- if more than 1 row deleted, or wrong row deleted:rollback tran -- and try again-- else (uncomment the following)-- commit trangocheckpointgoshutdown with nowaitgo=====================5 - restart the dataserver and you should find that the last fragment has been removed6 - disable direct update of system tables (sp_configure 'allow update',0)NOTE: I highly recommend you first test the above on a test database that you can afford to lose (in case you miss a step). DO NOT run this in production until you've successfully performed the steps on a test database!
title: Re:Shrink or Eliminate a Database Device Sybase 15.5

author: Shaun St Louis
text: Thank you Mark for a thorough explanation, greatly appreciated. I am going to add this to our internal documentation...and Yes we have a "development" environment to test this process out.Kindly,Shaun
title: Re:Shrink or Eliminate a Database Device Sybase 15.5

how to take transactional log backup in sybase ase 15.7?
text: Hello Experts,I want to take transactional log backup from sybase as 15.7. But when i executed the following command it got some error.dump tran PCD to "H:\SAP_DB_Backup\PCD\PCD_dbtrans16_12_2014_backup.bkp"I searched in net , but i didn't get a proper answer.Kindly helpRegardsPraveen
author: Praveen Ninan Alex
Mark A Parsons
text: The 'dump tran' command can only be used to dump transactions to a dump file if the log has *NOT* been truncated.The message is stating that at some point since the last database dump someone/something has truncated the transaction log (ie, discarded completed transactions from the log).-------------------If you want to dump the log to a file (eg, to be used later for database recovery) then you'll need to:1 - find and disable whatever is truncating your log (eg, make sure db option 'trunc log on chkpt' is not enabled; make sure no threshold actions have been assigned to the logsegment segment which issue a 'dump tran/truncate'; make sure all dbo's/sa's are aware of the consequences of issuing 'dump tran/truncate' and make sure it doesn't occur again)2 - perform a full database dump (dump database)3 - perform the log dump (dump tran); this will need to be performed on a regular basis (eg, via recurring job/script, via threshold action on the logsegment segment)-------------------I notice from your sample 'dump tran' command that your file's name is not very unique (eg, it does not contain a datetime component).If you plan on taking regular dumps of the transaction log (eg, to keep the log from filling up) then you'll need to make sure each 'dump tran' command references a unique file name (eg, <dataserver>.<database>.YYYYMMDD.HHMMSS.logdump).If you issue the same dump command twice (ie, with the same name for the dump file) then each successive 'dump tran' command will overwrite the dump file of the previous 'dump tran' command ... which has the effect of discarding the previous dump ... which means you won't be able to recover your log dumps (if the need arises).
title: Re:how to take transactional log backup in sybase ase 15.7?

author: Jeroen Rijnbergen
text: Good answer from Mark, but 1 thing missing...Why do you want to take the transaction log backup?If you just want to make sure the log is free and don't need the log for recovery, you might as well enable database option "trunc log on chkpt"If you still run into a log full situation, you might want to check long running transactions or increase the log size of that database
title: Re:how to take transactional log backup in sybase ase 15.7?

System.NullReferenceException: Object reference not set to an instance of an object.~~ at Sybase.Data.AseClient1.AseConnection.Open()
text: Hi All,We are getting random failures of sessions to the server. It's an booking system We are seeing these kind of errors: System.NullReferenceException: Object reference not set to an instance of an object.~~ at Sybase.Data.AseClient1.AseConnection.Open() More detailsASEClient 15.7 (Sybase.AdoNet4.AseClient 4.157.104.0, Size 6,96MB)Code_conexaoSybase = new AseConnection(CONNECTION_STRING_SYBASE);_conexaoSybase.NamedParameters = false; _conexaoSybase.Open();ErrorSystem.NullReferenceException: Object reference not set to an instance of an object. at Sybase.Data.AseClient1.AseConnection.Open() at Sybase.Data.AseClient.AseConnection.Open() at XYZ.Nucleo.Util.Contexto.Contexto.get_ConexaoSybase()We then loose all connection on that particular server and have to do a reset to resolve the problem. Any idea on what could be causing this ?Thanks in advanced!Daniel Castro
author: Daniel Castro
Kevin Walrod
text: Hi Ganimede,If you are expectin the uninstaller to remove the Sybase directory, and then clean up the environment variables, this is not going to happen. For whatever reason, the uninstaller doesn't work that way. After the uninstaller is run, you still need to delete the Sybase directory, and then remove references to Sybase from the System environment variables. Such as PATH, SYBASE, SYBASE_OCS, and so fourth. You can also go into the Registry > HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE > SOFTWARE > SYBASE and remove that directory.That will remove Sybase from the machine.If you have created and ODBC DSN's, you will need to go into the HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE > Wow64232Node > ODBC > ODBC.INI and remove the created data sources. You can also go into the ODBCINST.INI and delete the Adaptive Server Enterprise folder.Kevin
title: Re:The installer found unexpected changes to the install script

author: Dawn Kim
text: Hi David,I think you are hitting a known issue that was fixed. CR 733490 when IIS is recycled during a maintenance mode. When the pool is back online the ado.net driver starts throwing NullException.This was fixed in SDK 15.7 SP100 or higher the driver version would be #.157.1000.I suggest you upgrade to the current SDK 15.7 SP130 and use the current ado.net driver.Thanks,Dawn Kim

Segment Usage/Freespace by device.
text: I need the ability to monitor my segment usage by device in MB for data growth. The scripts I have found/developed are not providing the information I need.  At a minim the devices are separated by data and index. Would any one have a good script for this?Example.Database ScoobyDoo.database_name database_size ------------- ------------- ScoobyDoo 284536.0 MB reserved data index_size unused ------------ ----------- ----------- ---------- 164417808 KB 92098352 KB 70607632 KB 1709536 KBSegment Device PhyDvSize AssignedDvSize DataUsed %AvailSeg_SD_Data ScoobyDoo _Data1 81920 81000 79,999 0%Seg_SD_Data ScoobyDoo _Data2 81920 81000 54,399 33%Seg_SD_IDX1 ScoobyDoo _IDX_Shaggy 30000 29500 12,853 57%Seg_SD_IDX2 ScoobyDoo _IDX_Velma 30000 29200 15,478 48%
author: Karen Madore
Mark A Parsons
text: I would recommend taking look at the source code for the sp_helpsegment stored proc.While data space accounting is relatively easy, log space accounting gets a bit tricky, and some of the calculations vary from ASE version to ASE version (eg, 12.5.4 vs 15.7).
title: Re:Segment Usage/Freespace by device.

author: Karen Madore
text: So the below is what we developed for our segments at 16k pages. Select 'Segment Usage' select db_name(d.dbid) as db_name, v.name, "Data Size," = sum(size * abs(sign(segmap - 4))) *16/1024, "Data Used," = sum((size - curunreservedpgs(d.dbid, lstart, unreservedpgs)) * abs(sign(segmap - 4)))*16/1024 , convert(varchar(10),100-ceiling(100 * (1 - 1.0 * sum(case when u.segmap != 4 then curunreservedpgs(u.dbid, u.lstart, u.unreservedpgs) end) / sum(case when u.segmap != 4 then u.size end)))) as '% data space avail' from master..sysdatabases d, master..sysusages u, master..sysdevices v where u.dbid = d.dbid and d.status != 256 and v.vdevno = u.vdevnogroup by d.dbid, v.nameorder by d.dbid, v.name
title: Re:Segment Usage/Freespace by device.

author: Mark A Parsons
text: Sorry, but without some idea of *what* all of your possible database allocations look like, and what you think the report should look like, trying to 'debug' your SQL would be a waste of time.Also, your sample script doesn't match with the result set you provided in your first post, so even if someone were to analyze the query they'd be comparing apples to oranges.--------------------------I would suggest:1 - rethinking the general plan; because segments can span disk fragments, and multiple segments can reside on a single fragment, I'd recommend reporting on space at the segment level ... or log vs non-log (though this gets tricky with fragments that include data and log allocations)2 - take a look at the source code for sp_helpsegment; the logsegment calculations may take a few minutes to comprehend but once you understand how sp_helpsegment works you should have no problems coming up with a custom query to generate the report you wantNOTE: Once you've figured out how sp_helpsegment works you should look at removing the hard-coded page size (16) thus making sure you're query can run in any ASE.
title: Re:Segment Usage/Freespace by device.

author: Karen Madore
text: Actually, the code that I posted was the solution to my original question. I posted the interim solution thinking someone would like a starting point in case they where looking to solve a similar problem. The script has now been cleaned up and focuses on the non log segments.
title: Re:Segment Usage/Freespace by device.

author: Rajesh Neemkar
text: Hi Karen,Glad if you can share the complete script and the output you received.ThanksRajesh
title: Re:Segment Usage/Freespace by device.

title: Sybase ASE 15.5 select 1 in group by
text: Hi,I've writen a query likeselect 1from table xjoin table y on x.id = y.idgroup by y.col1, x.col2, x.col3now I would expect Sybase to return 1 row containing 1 field containing the value 1 for each group. Insteed only one row is returned containing 1 field with the value 1.Is this expected in Sybase?If I change the select to contain the actual grouped columns then I get 22000+ results...select y.col1, x.col2, x.col3from table xjoin table y on x.id = y.idgroup by y.col1, x.col2, x.col3
author: Bram Gadeyne
Bret Halford
text: The ability to write queries with GROUP BY that do not include all the columns from the GROUP BY in the SELECT is a TSQL extension of the ANSI standard, as is a SELECT clause without any aggregates. As the docs say, the results can sometimes be hard to understand.Substitute an aggregate for the simple literal and I think you will get a result more like what you were expecting (which truthfully doesn't seem very useful to me).select max(1)from sysobjects xjoin sysindexes y on x.id = y.idgroup by y.indid, x.id, x.namegoANSI would have you write the query with every column from the GROUP BY in the SELECTselect y.indid, x.id, x.name, max(1)from sysobjects xjoin sysindexes y on x.id = y.idgroup by y.indid, x.id, x.namego
title: Re:Sybase ASE 15.5 select 1 in group by

text: Hello Experts,We are frequently getting the error 692 in our development and Quality Servers(Production is not at go-live). After getting this error we are unable to work in the system, getting ST22 dumps like DBIF_REPO_SQL_ERROR , [ASE Error SQL21][SAP][ASE ODBC Driver][Adaptive Server Enterprise]WARNING - Fatal Error 692 occurred at Dec 19 2014 10:36PM. Please note the error and time, and contact a user with System Administrator (SA) authorization.#".Error in the ASE Error log isserver Error: 692, Severity: 20, State: 1server Uninitialized logical page '4136632' was read while accessing database 'SID' (4), object 'WDY_WB_GENINFO' (959403181), index 'WDY_WB_GENINFO~001' (3), partition 'WDY_WB_GENINFO~001_959403181' (959403181). Please contact Sybase Technical Support.server Error: 692, Severity: 20, State: 1server Uninitialized logical page '4135787' was read while accessing database 'SID' (4), object 'REPOSRC' (1540366417), index 'REPOSRC~0' (2), partition 'REPOSRC~0_1540366417' (1540366417). Please contact Sybase Technical Support.The dbcc checktable logs on these are attached to this thread.Please help us.
author: krishna G
Kiran Kumar Adharapuram
text: Krishna,Generally 692 errors can be handled by dbcc page command rather than the checktable()Obtain page information by running dbcc page as soon as possible, using the database ID and page number shown in your ASE Error log: 1> dbcc page (db_id, page_number, 0, 1, 1, -1) 2> goOr You can even suspect there may be Operating system error which would have caused this error, if you have access check the OS logs or contact the OS team.RegardsKiran Kumar A
title: Re:Sybase Server Error: 692, Severity: 20, State: 1

author: Benjamin Slade
text: It's a page corruption problem in Sybase. This is a bad thing. A lot of things could cause it.Some sort of bad operating system interaction. Eg. some other process modifying the devices/files Sybase is using to write it's data. Or maybe you have your Sybase devices on NFS? One of your disks is physically bad. Do you have disk mirroring at the operating system level or within Sybase?Or maybe the box was shutdown while the server was busy writing data?Maybe a backup was loaded into the wrong chunks in a destination database?You hit a Sybase bug? Do you have any stacktraces in Sybase before the 692 error(s)
title: Re:Sybase Server Error: 692, Severity: 20, State: 1

Cannot enable SSL feature. 00:0002:00000:00011:2015/01/08 14:20:24.36 kernel Cannot allocate resources for listener with protocol sslnlwnsck, host WIN-S32KZPJCUAU, port 5000. 00:0002:00000:00011:2015/01/08 14:20:24.36 kernel No license! Cannot enable SSL feature. 00:0002:00000:00011:2015/01/08 14:20:24.36 kernel Cannot allocate resources for listener with protocol sslnlwnsck, host WIN-S32KZPJCUAU, port 5000. 00:0002:00000:00011:2015/01/08 14:20:24.36 kernel Cannot start any network listeners. 00:0002:00000:00011:2015/01/08 14:20:24.36 kernel ueshutdown: exiting 00:0008:00000:00000:2015/01/08 14:20:24.36 kernel Sybperf helper thread is quitting 00:0002:00000:00011:2015/01/08 14:20:24.36 kernel Enterprise java bean server is already down. 00:0000:00000:00000:2015/01/08 14:20:24.39 kernel Main thread performing final shutdown. 00:0000:00000:00000:2015/01/08 14:20:24.65 kernel Blocking call queue shutdown. 00:0000:00000:00000:2015/01/08 14:20:25.07 kernel SySAM: Checked in license for 1 ASE_CORE (2015.1231/permanent/12FE BE55 1B69 AE84).
author: 辉辉 邓
Mark A Parsons
text: The error message seems to imply that you do not have the necessary license to enable SSL.I'm assuming you only have the ssl entry in your sql.ini file and since no security license is found said sql.ini entry fails. Without any other sql.ini entries (yes, you can define multiple entries in sql.ini with different network:port combos) the dataserver is unable to start any network listeners and so it shuts down.You'll need to a) get a security license (to allow enabling ssl) or b) add a non-ssl entry to your sql.ini file.

text: Hi,I am trying to install Sybase ASE ODBC driver for Windows on one of our test machine.According to this "http://www.sybase.com.sg/products/archivedproducts/odbc", ODBC driver is now a part of SDK product.For downloading SDK from http://downloads.sybase.com/swd/summary.do, requires a a Technical Support Contact registered with MySybase.Can someone please guide, how we can register with Sybase for this product? Do we need to procure a license and only the will this service be available?Thanks for your clarification and time.
author: Ganesh Borse
Ryan Hansen
text: Hi,The Sybase ASE ODBC Driver comes with the Software Developers Kit (SDK).You can find the downloads from:http://downloads.sybase.com/swd/summary.doAs you mentioned you need to be a Technical Support Contact.Go to www.Sybase.comSelect Login at the top right (if you do not have a login you can select "Register now!")Once logged in you can go to My Account, button is at the top right where the login was.Here you will see "Add Another Role"There is a check box for Technical Support Contact.They will ask you to validate this change through a technical Contact ID or customer number.If you want to go through this process with a phone call the number is:1 800 8SYBASE, Option 3 to speak with a Customer Server Representative.

author: Ryan Hansen
text: To download any Sybase products you need to be a customer and have a license through sales.Only other way I can think of would be a trial ASE download(customer install as Simon brought up)http://www54.sap.com/pc/tech/database/software/adaptive-server-enterprise/index.htmlorhttp://www.sybase.com/products/databasemanagement/adaptiveserverenterpriseI am not 100% positive ODBC will be in this trial download, but would be the only other way besides sales to get what you are looking for.I would suggest calling 1800-8SYBASE to help get you on the right direction.-Ryan

author: Ryan Hansen
text: Short response, I'm in tech suport and do not know specific licensing questions.I work more in the tech support rather than the licensing for the products themselves.I'm not as familar with what we allow customers to do without gathering fully paid licenses.To my knowledge, we do not offer any ODBC trials. This is because you do not need a generated license to run ODBC as you do for ASE (sysam licensing) and it would be impossible to monitor.The only trial is for ASE which is available from the above link.To make sure you are not doing something illegal or use a product without the specific license or agreement, I would talk to customer service or sales as they know what is allowed when using our products.1800-8SYBASE
title: Re:How to download Sybase ASE SDK?

author: Simon Ogden
text: Hi,The ODBC driver does also come with the ASE server product.The relevant files on Windows x64 will be in %SYBASE%\DataAccess64\ODBC.Metadata that needs to be installed on the target server will be in the sp folder.The main driver itself is called sybdrvodb64.dll in the dll folder, but it's best to copy them all, other will be needed if you intend to use certain security types etcRun regsvr32 sybdrvodb64.dll to register the driver with the odbc driver manager.If you want the latest fixes to the driver, then you do need access to the SDK. I *think* you get access to SDK if you have ASE license but best to check with the customer service team.Cheers,Simon

Reset sapsa password
text: Hi all, I need to reset the sapsa password of a sybase database. I've already recovered the sa password with the sap note 1872806 - How to set a new password for SA account in Sybase ASE server but I'm not very familiarised with the ALTER LOGIN and sp_password procedures. When I try to use any of those procedures, it asks me for the previous password of the sapsa user, which I don't have at the moment.Thanks in advance.Regards,JR
author: Jesus A. Rodriguez S.
Bret Halford
text: If you are saying that you used the Note 1872806 process to generate a new password for the sapsa login, and are now trying to set the sapsa login to a password of your chosing, the automatically generated new password is what the command is looking for when it asks for the previous or "old" password.-bret
title: Re:Reset sapsa password

author: Pankaj K Pathak
text: Hi Bret,Is any difference between -o(isql option/switch ) and output(isql command) .If any, Kindly let me know.Regards,Vivek
title: Re:Reset sapsa password

author: Bret Halford
text: Well, '-o' is for the isql client while 'output' is an Interactive SQL client command.Interactive SQL and isql are different clients applications.-o causes all the output of the entire session to be redirected to a file. It is typically used while executing a script file. It is possible to use it while interactively typing, but it causes you to be typing blind (as all output is going to the file, not being shown to you on the terminal).I believe "output" in Interactive SQL applies to the current batch (I almost never use this client).Current versions of isql have a more direct equivalent to "output" with the "> filename" and ">> filename" options after "go"-bret
title: Re:Reset sapsa password

author: Christoph Heimann
text: Hi Jesus,for changing ASE database user passwords in a SAP Business Suite Systems, please follow instructions in SAP Note 1706410. The note describes for every user how to change the password in ASE, updating the secure store of the application...Best regards--Christoph
title: Re:Reset sapsa password

author: Jesus A. Rodriguez S.
text: Hi Christoph, Is there a way to modify the passwords without knowing the old one? This is a system that I recently recovered but all the passwords are not available.Best regards,Jesus Rodriguez
title: Re:Reset sapsa password

author: Stefan Krause-Lichtenberg
text: Hello,so the sapsystem won't start cause the password is incorrect ? If this is the case you should combine both suggestions from Bret and Christoph, if you don't know any password for all logins. They key is the sapsso login:1st) Create a new password for sapsso. Follow KBA 1872806, but instead of -psa you should use:-psapssoThis way you will get a new very cryptic password for sapsso. Beware this is only printed to the console as mentioned in KBA 1872806.2nd) Now follow Note 1706410, and use the new password from sapsso to reset all passwords in the ASE and the secure store.Hope this will help.RegardsStefan
title: Re:Reset sapsa password

author: Christoph Heimann
text: Hi Jesus, Hi Stefan,I fully agree with Stefan. Please follow this approach which is mentioned above. When you finished this activities, please remove at the end the line-psapsso from the $SYBASE/$SYBASE_ASE/install/RUN_<SID> file.If you forget this you will generate with every reboot a new sapsso password. This is something you want to avoid :-)Best regardsChristoph
title: Re:Reset sapsa password

author: Mark A Parsons
text: As the messages indicate, the log in the archive_db is full. You'll need to extend the log.It looks like you may have already extended the log ... ~09:56-09:57 ... but that wasn't enough space as the log filled up again.As for why the log is filling up ... you'll need to find the spid(s) that are generating the log activity. Take a look at master..syslogshold (for oldest open transaction in the archive_db database) and master..systransactions (for all open transactions in the archive_db database).Once you find the spid(s) of interest, check the associated rows in master..sysprocesses, master..monProcess and master..monProcessLookup. The objective here is to get login, application, host and/or ipaddress details to help track down the application(s) that owns the spid(s).Also take a look at master..monProcessSQLText (for the associated spid(s)) to see what SQL is currently executing in archive_db. The objective is to use the SQL to a) determine the parent applicatoin and b) perhaps provide some details as to why the log is filling up (eg, is the query processing 10 million rows instead of 10 thousand rows?).
title: Re:archive_db full

How to find name of calling proc.
text: Hello Folks,How do I find out the name of the calling procedure form nested called procedure in ASE. I am trying to put a logic in a stored proc so it can only be executed from a specific proc or else exit from it.Thanks,Sid.
author: Siddhartha Sarkar
Mark A Parsons
text: If you can get the DBA to grant your login access to the mon_role role then you can query master..monProcessProcedures where SPID = @@spid.monProcessProcedures should contain a row for each stored proc in the nested/call tree.
title: Re:How to find name of calling proc.
Import backup from Sybase ASE12.5 to ASE 16
text: Is is possible to import a dumped database file from ASE12.5 into ASE 16?I would be going from 32 to 64 bits in a windows install.I know I have to match the pagesize, charset and sort_order of the source database.,..Also I can not seem to get tech support for a trial of Sybase 16. Just the the run around on the phones and everyone wants me to have a support contract and enter a ticket... what is the point of a trial if I have toe buy the product to try it?-Ken
author: Ken Leach
Mark A Parsons
text: I can't tell from your post if you're running the very basic ASE 12.5, or one of the follow-on releases (eg, 12.5.1, 12.5.2, 12.5.0.3, 12.5.4, etc) so fwiw ...From the ASE 16 Reference Manual: Commands: 'load database' restrictions:If you're running something earlier than 12.5.4 you could (obviously) always try the load to see what happens ... ?The 32-bit vs 64-bit question should not be an issue as long as you're on the same platform (ie, no difference in endianess).
title: Re:Import backup from Sybase ASE12.5 to ASE 16

author: Ken Leach
text: Thank you.. I got lucky the older version was 12.5.4... and I was able to load the smaller of the two DBs.My question is .. for the larger DB the compressed backup is 100GB. But it is saying it need 766GB of space to load it... is there anyway I can coalesce the data and shrink the needed space on the load? It seems like the older database was wasting lots of space.. I would like to correct that.. and I don't currently have 766GB of free space (working on it)..Suggestions?-Ken
title: Re:Import backup from Sybase ASE12.5 to ASE 16

author: Bret Halford
text: You might be able to use the Archive Database feature. (see Configuring an archive database)This allows you to access the dump file sort of as if it were a loaded dump. You could then extract DDL for objects, create the objects in a smaller database, and insert/select the data from the archive to the new database, or bcp the data out and back in.-bret
title: Re:Import backup from Sybase ASE12.5 to ASE 16

author: Ken Leach
text: When I load the older 12.5.7 database into 16 dev edition.It does not bring in the partitions for the tables.. and puts all data in to one partition..Is that because I am on the dev version or is it what happens on a load?-Ken
title: Re:Import backup from Sybase ASE12.5 to ASE 16

author: Mark A Parsons
text: With ASE 15.0 there was a major change in the physical structure of tables and indexes, in particular all tables/indexes are now 'partitioned' by default (partition count = 1); this in turn required a change in the system tables (syspartitions, sysslices, sysindexes, etc) to support the new 'partition id' construct.Net result is that pre-15.0 partitioned tables are unpartitioned during upgrade to (and loading into) ASE 15.x/16.x. The dbo then needs to determine if/how/when to repartition said tables ... repartition using round robin partitioning (basically the same thing that was available in pre-15.0) ... or get a new licen$e and implement semantic partitioning.I'm not sure at the moment if this detail still shows up in the ASE 15.7.x/16.x manuals, but in the ASE 15.0 release bulletin there was this item:
title: Re:Import backup from Sybase ASE12.5 to ASE 16

author: Ken Leach
text: That explains a lot.. thank you..Sadly MOST tables were partitioned.. so now I have to re-figure out each of the 2000 tables! Is there a faster way?-Ken
title: Re:Import backup from Sybase ASE12.5 to ASE 16

author: Mark A Parsons
text: In the Installation Guide for Windows, under the section titled System Requirements are the following entries about various patches:===========================Use the following patches: Microsoft Visual C++ 2010 Service Pack 1 Redistributable Package and KB2565063Microsoft Visual Studio 2010 Service Pack 1 and KB2565057... snip ...  Note: To use ODBC, OLE DB, or ADO.NET drivers, you must install Microsoft .NET Framework 2.0 Service Pack 1, or the installer displays errors, and the drivers do not function. Confirm that .NET Framework 2.0 Service Pack 1 is listed as a currently installed program in Control Panel > Add or Remove Programs.  Ensure that you have the required operating system patches for the SAP Java Runtime Environment (JRE) version 7. See SAP Note 1367498 (https://service.sap.com/sap/support/notes/1367498) for the JRE requirements. Log in with your SAP support account to view the SAP note.===========================Can you confirm you have the specific Microsoft KB's installed?While the documentation can be inconsistent about which patches to load (either/or vs both), I typically install both Microsoft patches to make sure I can install ASE on Windows.
title: Re:Can't install ASE16 on windows platform

author: Kimon Moschandreou
text: select user_name(uid)+'.'+name as table_name, count(*) num_of_partitionsfrom syspartitions p, sysobjects owhere p.id=o.idgroup by name,uidThe SQL above when run in a 12.5.* database returns table name and number of partitions and the following when run in ASE 12.5.4 database returns the alter table commands for ASE 16select 'alter table '+user_name(uid)+'.'+name+' by roundrobin '+cast(count(*) as varchar(3))+char(10)+'go'from syspartitions p, sysobjects owhere p.id=o.idgroup by name,uidReindexing and/or update statistics and then sp_recompile is a mustKimon
title: Re:Import backup from Sybase ASE12.5 to ASE 16

author: Chris Baker
text: Abhishek,There are some procedures documented in the manuals, however, the answer really depends on whether any databases have been corrupted in the first place and if the ASE can restart or not (possible corrupt master), and what the issue is.Bypassing the recovery process may or may not be the first step.The best thing to do in this situation is to engage technical support by opening an incident with SAP.There may also be some advanced education available on this topic on the SAP Education site:http://scn.sap.com/community/training-and-educationChris

author: Mark A Parsons
text: Question: Do you understand why the table, without an index, has 32KB assigned and 4KB used?Answer: ASE will allocate an extent (8x 4KB pages = 32KB) when the table is created, and then assign (ie, 'use') one of those pages for immediate use by the table-----------------Question: What happens when an index is created?Answer: ASE will also allocate an extent (8x 4KB pages = 32KB) when the index is created, and then assign (ie, 'use') one of those pages for immediate use by the index-----------------If you run 'sp_spaceused tmp,1' you'll get a detailed breakdown of allocated/used/unused space for each index.-----------------NOTE: If you're running ASE 15.7 ESD#2 (or higher), the 'create table' command has a 'deferred_allocation' option that delays the allocation of an extent (for the table and each index) until the first row is inserted.
title: Re:after creating index on table --reserved and unused space increase

author: David Desiderà
text: Hi All,after installing all VC++ 2010 and 2012 package plus all Windows Updates, it comes to my mind to check if framework .NET 3.5.1 feature was enabled on server: it wasn't !!I enabled it and restart the server and by magic ASE16 setup is gone straight!!RegardsDavid
title: Re:Can't install ASE16 on windows platform

author: Bret Halford
text: ASE allocates space in 8-page chunks that are called extents. 8 pages * 4kb/page = 32KB.sp_spaceused calls allocated space "reserved". Extents are allocated separately for the data rows itself and for each index and for LOB data. Although allocated 8 pages at a time, the pages are used one page at a time. Any allocated pages that aren't needed to hold data at this time are reflected as "unused" in sp_spaceused.
title: Re:after creating index on table --reserved and unused space increase

author: Bret Halford
text: The Archive Database feature was implemented primarily to allow users to extract table data from a dump without having to do a full load of the dump, which is both slower and requires disk space (sometimes substantial amounts when the dump is for a very large database).An example use case might be if a table was accidentally dropped but the business didn't want to revert the entire database back to the time of the last dump. Instead, the dump can be loaded as an archive database and just that table bcped out (or selected into a table in the main database). The data in that recovered table would be a bit stale compared to the rest of the database, but that might be preferable to losing hours of work.Note that an alternative method for a more up to date recovery is possible if tran log dumps were being taken, the full dump could be loaded and then the tran log dumps up to the one covering the time where the table was dropped, that last tran dump could then be loaded using the "with until_time" option to just before the table was dropped.There are other uses to Archive Databases, but access to object-level data without actually loading the full dump was the main business case for it.
title: Re:Need of archive Datbase in Sybase ASE

-307 All threads are blocked
text: We are new to sybase16. We have a few places in our powerbuilder application where the datawindow has a select stmt with multiple UNIONs. If the separate statements read from the same table, we are getting -307 All threads are blocked. This only happens on some new servers with multiple CPUs. It seems that Sybase is splitting up the entire stmt amongst the cpus, and they somehow conflict and cause the error. Even tho we are only reading rows. To solve this we were told to add this to the bottom:OPTION(max_query_tasks=1)This is working, because it is preventing Sybase from splitting up the stmt amongst cpus.I am being asked what the rule is, so that we can determine ahead of time which stmts will succeed and which will not.Factors seem to be:using UNION (which implies UNION DISTINCT and not UNION ALL),reading the same table, saying SELECT * from table_a where column_a = 'A' UNION SELECT * from table_a where column_a = 'B'Are those the rules?
author: Rita Grohn

title: Will ASE system defined error number fall into user defined error numbers starting from 20000?
text: The maximum error number in sysmessages:select max(error) from  master.dbo.sysmessagesON ASE 15.0.3column1 ---------- 19975   ON ASE 15.7select max(error) from  master.dbo.sysmessagescolumn1 ---------- 19999
author: Siddhartha Sarkar
Bret Halford
text: Hi Siddhartha,I don't expect ASE to start using error numbers in the user-defined range. I'm part of the group that reviews new messages, and conserving the shrinking pool of available numbers is certainly a concern of ours. We are actually still some ways away from running out of numbers.The error numbers are actually a concatenation of a major family number (the 100s values)and minor numbers 0-99 in each family. There are many families of errors that have unused values, one possibility is that we could use those unused values for errors that don't really belong in that family. Another thing we can do (though it would have to be in a major release of both open client and ASE) would be to introduce another mechanism that might work just the same as error messages but be called, say, "notifications" or "faults' (though that term is already used by checkstorage.There actually already exist two such families of messages, one called "errors" and the other called "messages". You can see this when configuring a shared memory dump, both are possible dump conditions. "Errors" show up in the errorlog displaying the message number, severity, and a state value, while "Messages" just display text and support has to look up the associated message number in the ASE sourcecode. (Not all text messages in the log are actual messages like this, some are just text that gets printed that one can't configure a memory dump on.)Cheers,-bret
title: Re:Will ASE system defined error number fall into user defined error numbers starting from 20000?

author: Mark Kusma
text: Hi Sid,In addition to Bret' comments, I have been informed that ASE will start reusing some existing error message numbers that were used in older releases. You may need to watch for this if running multiple releases.Regards,Mark
title: Re:Will ASE system defined error number fall into user defined error numbers starting from 20000?
Why there is not info from stacktrace in errorlog
text: Hi,Yesterday a process stacktraced in our production environment. In the errorlog I only got:00:0013:00000:00341:2015/03/09 06:20:01.04 kernel Current process (0x44af01cd) infected with signal 11 (SIGSEGV)...No more information in errorlog.I tried to get the process stacktrace and I received00:0008:00000:00491:2015/03/09 14:16:43.35 kernel ucstkgentrace: Process 1152319949 could not be stopped for tracingThis process also got an stacktrace without more information:00:0009:00000:00491:2015/03/09 14:18:28.39 kernel Current process (0x168701c3) infected with signal 11 (SIGSEGV)Our version is  Adaptive Server Enterprise/15.7/EBF 23820 SMP SP132 /P/RS6000/AIX 6.1/aAIX version 7.1The server does not shutdown normally, only kill -9 at OS level finishes the process.Any clue on what is going on?Regards,Luz Rodriguez
author: Luz del Carmen Rodriguez
Bret Halford
text: I don't find any known bugs that really match this. I have seen cases before where just the "infected with 11" line was printed, with no stack trace. Typically we have you set up a configurable shared memory dump (CSMD) for the infected with 11 condition and support can then extract the stack trace from the resulting dump one way or another.KBA 2107409 provides details on how to configure for a CSMD. http://service.sap.com/sap/support/notes/2107409I tend to suspect the spid is in some kind of "runaway" state, perhaps stuck in a tight code loop while trying to output the stack, based on the message and the difficulty in shutting down ASE, but that is only a guess.-bret
title: Re:Why there is not info from stacktrace in errorlog

author: Luz del Carmen Rodriguez
text: Hi Bret,We found that the process was send a dbcc stacktrace and it received the infected with 11. The AIX machine is using hardening version 7. Do you think that the stacktrace generation was affected by the hardening. Can you tell me if this make sense?Regards,

text: Hi,We found the problem. During SP132 installation libraries libbtsymbols.so and libsybibmmq were not replaced. suppress warnings re exclusive locking
text: We're using ASE 15.7 on Windows but this may apply to other platforms. Certain stored procs where we're locking a table in exclusive mode inside a trans generate warnings: (number 12103, Severity 10)Table 'x' in database 'y' was not locked in 'exclusive' mode because a covering lock in 'exclusive' mode was found.I guess I have 2 questions - are we doing something wrong that's causing this and is there a way to suppress these? According to the docs it's informational.
author: David Hrivnak
Bret Halford
text: Hi David,You aren't doing anything particularly wrong.If you were writing your own reporting client using the Open Client SDK, or perhaps using some existing client that had some features for defining error handlers, you avoid seeing the message by using an error handler that did not output it. If you are using a general purpose client like isql, there currently isn't a way to directly surpress output of the message. There is an open feature request for that, CR 234335. However, it has been open since 2001, and I don't expect to see any action on it soon. (You could open an incident to express your interest in it and increase its priority if you wish). However, there is also a way to just avoid the message in the first place.The message is output when you use LOCK TABLE to request a lock that you already have.You can avoid it by checking master..syslocks to see if you already have such a lock and only calling LOCK TABLE if you don't have it.if not exists ( select id from master..syslocks where id = object_id("t1") and type = 1 and spid = @@spid )begin lock table t1 in exclusive modeend------ demonstration:create table t1 (c1 int)gobegin tranlock table t1 in exclusive mode - - create an existing exlusive table lockgolock table t1 in exclusive mode -- try to get another exclusive table lockgo -- this outputs the messageif not exists (select id from master..syslocks where id = object_id("t1") and type = 1 and spid = @@spid)begin lock table t1 in exclusive modeendgo -- this does not output the messagerollback trango id dbid page type spid class fid context row loid partitionid nodeid ----------- ------ ---------- ------ ------ ------------------------------ ------ ------- ------ ----------- ----------- ------(0 rows affected) id dbid page type spid class fid context row loid partitionid nodeid ----------- ------ ---------- ------ ------ ------------------------------ ------ ------- ------ ----------- ----------- ------ 576002052 6 0 1 14 Non Cursor Lock 0 0 0 28 0 NULL(1 row affected)
title: Re:suppress warnings re exclusive locking
How to Increase the Transaction Log size?
text: Hi,Currently, we are having problems with our transaction log due to its size which quickly get full. Our transaction log size is only 1024 MB or 1 GB and we usually dump the transaction log just to free up the space. How do we increase the size of our transaction log?I'm new on this sybase database.Thanks,Joven
author: Joven Sanico
Bret Halford
text: Hi Joven,You would use the ALTER DATABASE command.alter database <dbname> log on <logicalDeviceName> = <size>Example:alter database mydb log on mylogdev = "100M"goIf you don't have a suitable device with enough free space on it handy, you would either create a new one using the DISK INIT command, or enlarge an existing one using the DISK RESIZE command. In both cases, you would want to coordinate with your OS system administrator to ensure the OS had the space available. (This can be a very quick conversation if you are also the OS SA).Cheers,-bret
title: Re:How to Increase the Transaction Log size?

author: Joven Sanico
text: Hi Bret,I have a user in our server OS which is the sybase database owner. Also I have checked the filesystem where our transaction log is located and has enough free space to extend the transaction log.How does DISK RESIZE work? I think I just need to resize our transaction log to a bigger size.Thanks,Joven
title: Re:How to Increase the Transaction Log size?

author: Kiran Kumar Adharapuram
text: Joven,Its simple1>disk resize 2>name = "<Device_Name", 3>size = "XXXM"4>goExample:1>disk resize 2>name = "ABC_Data_001", 3>size = "1024M"4>goWhere XXX denotes the size which is need to increase provided you have the space in the mount point.Usage:The disk resize command allows you to dynamically increase the size of your disksAfter you resize a device, dump the master device, which maintains the size of the device in the sysdevices table. If you attempt a recovery from an old dump of the master device, the information stored in sysdevices will not be current.Any properties that are set on the device continue to be set after you increase its size.During the physical initialization of the disk, if any error occurs due to insufficient disk space, disk resize extends the database device to the point before the error occurs.PS: Last point is very important RegardsKiran K Adharapuram
title: Re:How to Increase the Transaction Log size?

author: Joven Sanico
text: Hi Kiran,Do I need to execute first the use master go before issuing the disk resize? Also after disk resize, do I need to alter database? Sorry I've got many questions since I'm new in sybase database.Thanks,Joven
title: Re:How to Increase the Transaction Log size?

author: Kiran Kumar Adharapuram
text: Joven,This is the sequence:1> use master1> disk resize name='<Device_Name>', size='1024M'2> go1> alter database <DB_Name> ON <Device_Name> ='1024M'2> goAs example I gave 1024MB, you can increase accordingly, also if you need to increase the log the disk resize remains same but there is change in alter:1> alter database <DB_Name> log ON <Device_Name> ='1024M'2> goRegardsKiran K Adharapuram
title: Re:How to Increase the Transaction Log size?

author: Joven Sanico
text: Hi Kiran,I tried the steps you have mentioned and it increased the transaction log but now it is bigger than I wanted as it added the previous size with the size I issued. For example: my transaction log before is 10GB and I issued your command disk resize to 12GB, then it add up the 10GB I have so the total log size now is 22GB.How can I adjust it to 12GB only? I just want my transaction log size to be 12GB.Thanks,Joven
title: Re:How to Increase the Transaction Log size?

author: Kiran Kumar Adharapuram
text: Joven,That is what the Sybase functionality is the value which you gave in size is the additional value what it will configure. Only the memory configuration(max memory, cache) which are done from isql has the functionality what you said above Coming to your question:There is a concept called Shrink the log/database:The supported way to reduce the size of a device would be to dump all the databases that have allocations on that device, then drop all those databases, then drop the device (sp_dropdevice from the ASE side and, if using file system devices, an RM or DEL on the file from the OS side), then DISK INIT a new device of the desired (smaller) size, then CREATE DATABASE FOR LOAD for all the dropped databases, then LOAD DATABASE from the dump files for all the dropped databases.Might be better to just leave the free space around for future expansion. There is a beautiful blog: Shrinking Database with ASE 15.7Shrinking Log Space: SyBooks OnlineShrinking Database: http://infocenter.sybase.com/help/index.jsp?topic=/com.sybase.infocenter.dc00641.1570100/doc/html/mas1343943986393.htmlRegardsKiran K Adharapuram
title: Re:How to Increase the Transaction Log size?

Why does ASE treats not exists value as null.
text: Here is a repro that ASE 15.0.3 treats a non existant value as null value.Looks like the case statement is applied after result set being created. Is this a normal behavier on outer joins?create table table1 ( id int, b int )gocreate table table2 ( id int, c int null )goinsert table1 values ( 1, 1)goinsert table1 values ( 2, 2)goinsert table1 values ( 3, 3)goinsert table1 values ( 4, 4)goinsert table2 values ( 1, 0)goinsert table2 values ( 2, 1)goinsert table2 values ( 3, null)goselect x.id, x.b, case when y.c is null then 'Created' when y.c = 0 then 'Inspected' when y.c = 1 then 'Approved' when y.c = 2 then 'Deleted' else 'Not exists' end as Statusfrom table1 x left join table2 yon x.id = y.idgoselect x.id, y.id, x.b, case when y.c is null then 'Created'  when y.c = 0 then 'Inspected' when y.c = 1 then 'Approved' when y.c = 2 then 'Deleted' else 'Not exists'  end as Statusfrom table1 x left join table2 yon x.id = y.idgoThanks,Sid.
author: Siddhartha Sarkar
Bret Halford
text: Yes, this is normal. With an outer join, the result set will contain every value from the outer table, with NULLs filled in where there isn't a match from the inner table.
title: Re:Why does ASE treats not exists value as null.

author: Siddhartha Sarkar
text: I understand unmatched values will be shown as null and is normal on outer joins.My question is why case conditions are applied after result set being materilized and not before on the column content.I know It can be fixed in the code using derived table.Thanks.
title: Re:Why does ASE treats not exists value as null.

author: Kevin Sherlock
text: It's just a case of semantics here. You are applying case conditions on a column that can be either explicitly null, or implicitly null. Try this first as it makes more sense to test the join column for missing rows:select x.id, x.b,  case when (y.id is not null and y.c is null) then 'Created'  when (y.id is not null and y.c = 0) then 'Inspected'  when (y.id is not null and y.c = 1) then 'Approved'  when (y.id is not null and y.c = 2) then 'Deleted'  when (y.id is null) then 'Not exists'  else 'Unknown' end as Status from table1 x left join table2 y on x.id = y.id
title: Re:Why does ASE treats not exists value as null.

SAP ASE 16
text: is there any way to start identity column value(seed value) from negetive integer like -1 ThanksRahul
author: rahul srivastava
Bret Halford
text: Not directly. You can create the table so that it has both the true identity column and another column, which would be a computed column that applies some transformation on the identity column. For example, if you wanted numbers that started at -1 and decreased, the computed column could be "identity * -1". If you wanted a value that increased by 3 each time, the computed column could be "identity * 3".-bret
title: Re:SAP ASE 16

text: Thanks -Gaurav

Number of Veriable length column Exceeds limit of 254 for all page locked table
text: Error "Number of Veriable length column Exceeds limit of 254 for all page locked table" why this coming if the column limit supports 1024 columns in a table and how the settings {allpages | datapages | datarows} use during table creation resolve the same and is there any performance degradation if will use lock data rows datapages.
author: rahul srivastava
Bret Halford
text: The limit is due to the internal representation of the row. ALLPAGES is the older format and used just one byte to store the number of variable length values included in the row. The newer DOL format, used for both datarows and datapages, uses 2 bytes and so is more flexible in how many variable length columns it can support.As for performance: it depends on how the table is used. See Choosing the locking scheme for a table in the documentation for general advice.-bret
title: Re:Number of Veriable length column Exceeds limit of 254 for all page locked table

author: rahul srivastava
text: Thanks for the valuable information.-Rahul

title: Re:How can i Switch database inside procedure in Sybase ASE

author: Mark A Parsons
text: You can combine a few basic ASE features that'll allow you to execute a vast majority of ASE commands in a any database.Basic features:1 - Most (but not all) commands can be submitted to ASE via a exec(<string_arg>) call, where '<string_arg>' is a string containing the command(s) you wish to execute. For variable commands the SQL developer can populate a local @variable with the desired command(s) and then issue exec(@variable).2 - Any stored procs created in the sybsystemprocs database with a prefix of 'sp_' can be executed from within any database in the dataserver. You're likely familiar with quite a few of these procs that come with ASE, eg, sp_who, sp_help*, sp_configure, etc. There's nothing to keep the DBA from adding his/her own sp_* procs to the sybsystemprocs database so that they can be executed from within any database.3 - When executing a stored proc, if you preface the proc name with '<dbname>..', said proc will be executed from within the <dbname> database ... just as if you had issued 'use <dbname>' followed by 'exec <procname>...'. In the following example, the user is sitting in the master database but viewing the contents of the testdb database:==================use mastergo-- run the sp_helpdb proc in the testdb databaseexec testdb..sp_helpgo... list of all objects in the testdb database==================------------Using all of these features it's possible to create a sp_* proc that accepts a long string; a string that contains your desired command(s).The sp_* proc can then be run in any database by simply prefacing the sp_* call with the name of the database.For example:==================-- give my proc dataserver-wide access by creating-- in the sybsystemprocs database with a prefix of 'sp_'use sybsystemprocsgo-- I tend to add an extra '_' to distinguish my custom procs from-- those provided by SAP/Sybaseif object_id('sp__execute_command') is not NULL drop proc sp__execute_commandgocreate proc sp__execute_command@command varchar(16384)asexec(@command)go-- grant permissions as you see fitgrant execute on sp__execute_command to publicgo-- while sitting in the master database ...use mastergo-- create a new table in the testdb database, and-- grant 'select' to the public groupexec testdb..sp__execute_command 'create table t1 (a int, b int) grant select on t1 to public'go-- let's go see if it worked ...use testdbgosp_help t1goName Owner Object_type Object_stats Create_date---- ----- ----------- -------------------- -------------------t1 dbo user table keep first text page May 29 2015 9:04PM... snip ...sp_helprotect t1gograntor grantee type action object column predicate grantable------- ------- ----- ------ ------ ------ --------- ---------dbo public Grant Select t1 All NULL FALSE==================------------This is a very basic example. Keep in mind ...- the caller is responsible for submitting a) syntactically correct commands and b) knowing which commands can in fact be submitted via the exec() construct- you'll find that most exec() calls that deal with DDL commands usually cannot be run inside a transaction sooo, do you add some checks to verify you're not in a txn before making the exec() call, or leave this up to the caller to address as s/he sees fit?- you'll need to decide who has permissions to execute the sp_* proc; alternatively add logic in the proc to verify the caller's credentials in the database where the proc is executed- I'm not 100% sure the exec() can actually handle a 16K string ... so you'll need to test that out if you plan on submitting some really long commands
title: Re:How can i Switch database inside procedure in Sybase ASE

Finding actual disk space usages before shrinking database.
text: Greetings, I have databases with dedicated devices meaning a specific device being used by one DB only. How do I find out actual disk space being used before I decide to shrink the database. I can run dbcc allocdump in loop and then find it using a script. Is there any other method.Thanks,Sid.
author: Siddhartha Sarkar
Mark A Parsons
text: "sp_helpdb <dbname>" will show the amount of free space on data devices fragments."sp_helpsegment <segment_name>" (at top of output) will show free space per disk.If none of these (dbcc allocdump, sp_helpdb, sp_helpsegment) provide what you're looking for then you'll need to provide more details on what exactly it is you are looking for.
title: Re:Finding actual disk space usages before shrinking database.

author: Bret Halford
text: dbcc usedextents(dbname,0,1,1) will give you a summary of usage by device fragment (i.e. row in sysusages)1> set switch on 36042> goSwitch 3604 ('print_output_to_client') is turned on.All supplied switches are successfully turned on.1> dbcc usedextents(test,0,1,1)2> goDisk piece 0 (1536 pages), extents used = 111, free = 81Disk piece 1536 (1280 pages), extents used = 0, free = 160Total used extents = 111Total free extents = 241Total extents = 352DBCC execution completed. If DBCC printed error messages, contact a user withSystem Administrator (SA) role.-bret
title: Re:Finding actual disk space usages before shrinking database.

author: Siddhartha Sarkar
text: Thanks Bret, How accurate is sp_helpdb output. Meaning how often does ASE need to refresh internally or is this automatic when ASE allocates or releases pages/extents to/from objects so curunreservedpgs always gives accurate results.Thanks,Sid.
title: Re:Finding actual disk space usages before shrinking database.
SYSAM and startserver problem.
text:
Hello everyone,I encountered the following error, when I tried start SYSAM and then startserver.
hostname SYSAM-2_0/bin> ./sysam start
Starting the SYSAM License Server using licenses from:
 /sybase/XYZ/SYSAM-2_0/licenses

Stored procedure runs extremely slow in certain scenarios
text: Greetings!In our batch scheduler, we call the same stored procedure (let's call it "my_proc") twice.batch job 1a: execute my_proc("dinosaurs")batch job 1b: execute my_proc("humans")Now I list it as 1a and 1b because they can run in any sequence (normally 1a always runs first, followed by 1b 2 minutes later in reality).My problem:When 1a runs first, followed by 1b, the result is:1) "dinosaurs" ends up dealing with about 30k records and runs in about 6 seconds2) "humans" ends up dealing with about 180k records and runs in about 20 minutesIt's been this way for a long time, so we tried a couple things to improve the situation to confusing results:Experiment 1) Recompiled the stored procedure and then executed batch job 1b, so that it'd store the query plan for this first run and it finished in about 35 seconds, which is a vast improvement from 20 minutes. Next, batch job 1a ran that night in its normal 6 seconds. About 24 hours later, we let the batch run on its own so 1a runs first in 6 seconds, but 1b runs in its normal 20 minutes again!Experiment 2) Force job 1b to always run first, followed by 1a. This resulted in job 1b always running in 35 seconds, followed by 1a running in 6 seconds!QuestionNow one solution we have is to force a dependency so that 1a depends on 1b before execution, however we'd like to decouple these jobs as they really shouldn't depend on each other from a data perspective. Does anyone know what the problem is and what the possible solutions may be?One theory I have is that the procedure cache is coming into play here, but, if that is the case, I don't know how to fix this unless I create a new stored procedure maybe with the same name? (Before you ask me to try this, we can't replicate this in a test environment as they always run fast with the same data set for some reason, trying various combination of execution sequences. Production is where we are experiencing this performance issue.)Thank you in advance!
author: Johnny Diep
Mark A Parsons
text: When a proc is executed Sybase will attempt to re-use any query plans that still reside in cache. If no such plans reside in cache then the proc is (re)compiled and a new set of query plans is generated/used.Over time if a proc is not used its query plans can be flushed from cache, thus requiring a (re)compilation the next time the proc runs. (This would explain what you saw in Experiment #1, ie, after 24 hours the query plans were flushed from cache so 1a generated a new set of plans when it ran, followed by 1b re-using a 'bad' set of plans.)If you don't plan on running this proc very often (eg, thousands of times a day) you can tell Sybase to recompile the proc when it's run. You'll incur a small amount of cpu/compilation overhead each time the proc is compiled, but said compilation time is likely much smaller than the savings you'll get from making sure 1b always gets a 'good' query plan.You have a couple (relatively) easy options for forcing the proc to recompile when it's run:1 - explicitly force a recompilation when you execute the proc; this example assumes 'isql' command line (I'm not sure how you'd add the 'with recompile' clause to your application): execute my_proc "humans" with recompileNOTE: If you do run this proc a lot, you could supply the 'with recompile' clause for just those instances where you know you need to generate a new/good set of query plans.2 - force a recompilation every time the proc is executed create proc my_proc (@arg varchar(100)) with recompile as ... snip ...-------------As for why test always runs fast but prod shows slowness, could be a few different issues ...1 - different index structures in the 2 environments2 - columns with different datatypes in the 2 environments3 - different volume or distribution of data in the 2 environments4 - different sets of stats in the 2 environments (eg, test has had 'update index stats' run, while prod had 'update stats' run)5 - test always has a copy of the fast/1b query plan in cacheAddressing any/all of these issues may allow 1b to run fast all the time in prod (without the 'with recompile' clause), but that'll require digging into the 2 environments to see where the performance difference is coming from ...
title: Re:Stored procedure runs extremely slow in certain scenarios

author: Johnny Diep
text: Thank you for the extremely helpful reply, Mark!It would probably be easier for us to implement option 2 (create proc ... with recompile). I'll look into this more and hope to test this in the production scenario.So if we use "with recompile", Sybase will explicitly not use whatever's in the cache, correct? Does Sybase purge the query plan from cache (if there exists one)?
title: Re:Stored procedure runs extremely slow in certain scenarios

author: Mark A Parsons
text: For option 2 just keep in mind (and this is more for anyone coming across this thread in the future, eg, via a google search) ...Creating a proc 'with recompile' will require the proc to be compiled *every* time it's executed. This is likely ok if the proc is not executed very often and/or the compilation overhead is minimal. On the other hand, using this method for a proc that is executed a lot of times in a short period of time, or which requires a high overhead for compilation, could degrade performance not only for most of the folks running the proc but also eat up precious dataserver cpu cycles that could be better used elsewhere.At one client there was a developer who saw how well 'create proc ... w/recompile' worked for a particular batch process (ie, proc was not called very often, and the forced recompilation meant the difference of the proc running in 2 minutes vs 5+ hrs), that he decided to use 'create proc ... w/recompile' for another proc that would occasionally go walkabout. The problem with his solution ... this particular proc was called ... literally ... a million times a day; said proc normally ran in something like 6ms; the forced recompilation for *every* execution of the proc added upwards of 80ms to each execution of the proc, bumped up overall dataserver cpu usage by 350%, and caused a lot of contention on the system tables used for compilation. In that particular case we had to spend more time understanding why the proc went walkabout and then come up with a solution that did not require excessive use of 'with recompile'.--------------------------------As for your proc cache question ...I suggest you run some tests and pay attention to what happens to the contents of master..monCachecProcedures (mCP).In particular, pay attention to a) the number of entries in mCP for your proc and b) how mCP.CompileDate changes when a proc is (re)compiled.
title: Re:Stored procedure runs extremely slow in certain scenarios

author: Kevin Sherlock
text: When you "create proc xxx with recompile" - When you execute that proc, a plan is cached and executed, and then immediately removed after execution. There is no other task that will ever reuse that plan because it is removed from proc cache.When you "execute proc yyy with recompile" - After execution of the proc, a cached plan is left behind in proc cache, and can be reused by another task as long as it stays in proc cache. This is why in the documentation it states that it can swamp proc cache with many plans for this procedure if you execute in this manner repeatedly.Disadvantages to either approach only really concern repeated executions, in tight loops for example. As Mark states, the disadvantage with "create with recompile" is the compile time incurred if the proc is executed many times. Disadvantage with "exec with recompile" is that many plans will be cached (one for each such execution), and force other plans out of cache. Not only that, you might not _want_ another task to get your cached plan because it was compiled with boundary parameters etc.
title: Re:Stored procedure runs extremely slow in certain scenarios

author: Johnny Diep
text: Thanks! This is really helpful. It looks like "create... with recompile" is what I need. This procedure only runs nightly, so the overhead is not much of a concern.
title: Re:Stored procedure runs extremely slow in certain scenarios

Enabling disabling Log transaction
text: Hello,I've read about the option to disable the transaction log.I need to user master database to execute the command for disable transaction log por database ECP?If I want to disable transaction log isuse mastergosp_dboption ECP, 'trunc',truegouse SBPgocheckpointgoIf I wanto to enable again the transaction log is simply to change the true option for false?The checkpoint command is mandatory to change the mode of transaction log?Regards
author: ruben torres
De-Li Xu
text: Have you execute $SYBASE/$SYBASE_ASE/scripts/installmaster on the server? Your upgrade process may not be completed.
title: Re:Upgrate to 15.7 : show_cached_text() function return NULL

author: Bret Halford
text: The "truncate log on checkpoint" option does not actually disable the log. It does cause ASE to try to truncate the log each time the system checkpoint process executes a checkpoint, which keeps the log pruned up to the beginning of the oldest open transaction. Log records are still generated and used for transaction rollbacks, though.It is not necessary to manually issue a checkpoint command after sp_dboption. A long time ago a manual checkpoint was required after sp_dboption, but ASE has been automatically doing so for quite some time now.If you want to turn this option off and return to a state where you can create transaction log dumps for recovery, you need to turn this option to false, then perform a full database dump (as a starting point for future transaction log dumps). You will then be able to dump the transaction log to an archive device.-bret
title: Re:Enabling disabling Log transaction

Sybase Tape drive backup procedure
text: Hii All,I wanted to take SAP database backup on the tape drive. My database is SYBASE ASE and we are using version 15.7. And my Operating System is Windows server 2012. As I am taking backup on the disk itself but now i want to take and configure backup on the tape drive. So please can you guide me with its commands and various strategies of backup. I am using following commands for database backup: -dump database <SID> to location of the backupgoThanks in advance.Regards,Omkar
author: Omkar More
Ankitha Malalur Gopal
text: Hi Omkar,Greeetings for the day..!!!!  I recommend you to use the already available stored procedure: "sp_config_dump"With SAP Sybase ASE 15.7.0.021 and higher you can configure database and transaction log dumps.A dump configuration is stored in the ASE server configuration file and specifies all the necessary configuration parameters for the dump, such as a target directory where dumps are stored, the compression rate, and other parameters.Create your dump configuration with stored procedure 'sp_config_dump'. If the name of the database is, for example, P01:Configuration P01DB:1> sp_config_dump @config_name='P01DB', 2> @stripe_dir = '/sybase/P01/backups' ,3> @compression = '101' ,4> @verify = 'header'5> go  PS: To backup onto the tape drive: Use the parameter @stripe_dir: specify the tape drive pathname  Also make sure to disable the option "truncate log on checkpoint" for the database safer side before taking backup as that mag fail and give you warning, I hope you already would have done this but wanted to specify the same from my side  Further more you can get the details from http://infocenter.sybase.com Even this SAP Note helps you: http://service.sap.com/sap/support/notes/1588316 Regards,Ankitha
title: Re:Sybase Tape drive backup procedure
bcp out utility issues in Sybase 15.7
text: Hi All,when i am doing the bcp out from Sun Solaris OS then file's data is not getting generated with special characters. But where as., When i am executing the same bcp out from Linux OS ( same DB Server) then the file 's data is getting generated with special characters.Checked the data in database@isql utility in Sun Solaris then data had not displayed with special characters. where as i checked the data in same database@isql utility in Linux Machine then data shows with special characters. seems like data encoded with special characters.Query : why do we have such behavioral differences between the Versions . Is it because of charset mismatching between DB Server's and Client's in Linux OS? if there is any provision to generate the data without special characters from Linux Server using bcp. Do we have any such options in bcp utiliy. any other solutions Please advise. Thanks for your help in advance. Sun Solaris:We are using the below version of sybase aseisql -vSybase CTISQL Utility/15.0/P-EBF15809 ESD #13 ONE-OFF/DRV.15.0.5/SPARC/Solaris 8bcp -vSybase CTBCP Utility/15.0/P-EBF15809 ESD #13 ONE-OFF/DRV.15.0.5/SPARC/Solaris 8language : env | egrep 'LANG|LC_'LC_MONETARY=en_US.ISO8859-1LC_TIME=en_US.ISO8859-1LC_ALL=LC_MESSAGES=CLC_CTYPE=en_US.ISO8859-1LC_COLLATE=CLC_NUMERIC=en_US.ISO8859-1Linux:We are using the below version of Sybase ase:Sybase CTISQL Utility/15.7/P-EBF23258 SP130/DRV.15.7.0.13/Linux Intel/Linux 2.6.18-128.el5 i686/BUILD1570-044Sybase CTBCP Utility/15.7/P-EBF23258 SP130/DRV.15.7.0.13/Linux Intel/Linux 2.6.18-128.el5 i686/BUILD1570-044LANG=en_US.UTF-8LC_CTYPE="en_US.UTF-8"LC_NUMERIC="en_US.UTF-8"LC_TIME="en_US.UTF-8"LC_COLLATE="en_US.UTF-8"LC_MONETARY="en_US.UTF-8"LC_MESSAGES="en_US.UTF-8"LC_PAPER="en_US.UTF-8"LC_NAME="en_US.UTF-8"LC_ADDRESS="en_US.UTF-8"LC_TELEPHONE="en_US.UTF-8"LC_MEASUREMENT="en_US.UTF-8"LC_IDENTIFICATION="en_US.UTF-8"LC_ALL=We have the default charset as below in Sybase ASE database:Character Set = 1, iso_1  ISO 8859-1 (Latin-1) - Western European 8-bit character set.  Sort Order = 50, bin_iso_1  Binary ordering, for the ISO 8859/1 or Latin-1 character set (  iso_1). Data shows with special character as :  in database@isql in Linux, @bcp in Linux.
author: Belgum Sridhar
Bret Halford
text: This does sound like a character set conversion issue. By default, clients on Solaris use iso_1 while clients on Linux use UTF8. However, it does seem a bit confusing as the server is using iso_1, so any character in it should be find in either client character set. What displays in place of the accented A on Solaris?
title: Re:bcp out utility issues in Sybase 15.7

author: Vincent Rives
text: Could you post the actual BCP commands you are trying to run on both OS?
title: Re:bcp out utility issues in Sybase 15.7

author: Dawn Kim
text: Hi,It is exactly how Bret described the LANG env for each environment is different. With BCP you can use the -J option and list how you want the character set to something else.re: SyBooks OnlineThe other thing you can do is change the default charset on the box if you use the LANG and change this to iso1 or C or something that suits you.Thanks,Dawn Kim

Finding cardinality from sysstatistics
text: Hello Folks, Is there a way to find cardinality of an index column from sysstatistics,systabstats instead of a select statement on a very large table?Thanks,Sid.
author: Siddhartha Sarkar
Avinash Kothare
text: Hi SidIf you need exact number of rows for each value of the index column then "group by" query is the only way you can get that.If all you need is approximate count(s) for index value(s) then optdiag output has the weight for the value (e.g. we have a dummy value of 1 for an identity column for a large number of rows, skewing the index ) it can give you approximate number of rows out of the total number for that value.HTHAvinash
title: Re:Finding cardinality from sysstatistics
